0.title: Horrific experience: Shabana Azmi on 21-yr-old niece left on bridge at night by Ola driver
0.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi shared her 21-year-old niece's "horrific experience" where her Ola cab allegedly left her mid-ride on Mumbai's Dadar bridge in the night. "Driver realised...he'd reach home late due to traffic...so he made me get off on Dadar bridge," her niece said. "I had to walk down the bridge...It took me 2 hours to reach my destination," she added.

1.title: Stakhovsky to take up arms to fight Russia, says 'I've experience with a gun'
1.article_body: Former Ukrainian tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky has enlisted himself in his country's reserve army amid war with Russia. "I would fight, it’s the only reason I’m trying to get back. I don’t have military experience, but I do have experience with a gun privately," he said. Earlier, Klitschko brothers took up arms to defend Ukraine against Russia.

2.title: Japanese billionaire donates $8.7 mn to Ukraine, says 'Met Ukraine Prez in 2019'
2.article_body: Japanese billionaire Hiroshi 'Mickey' Mikitani, the Chairman and CEO of electronic commerce company Rakuten, has donated $8.7 million to Ukraine. He called Russia's attack "a challenge to democracy". In a letter to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Hiroshi said, "I vividly remember the early summer of 2019 as if it were yesterday when I visited Kiev and met with you."

3.title: Australian cricket team lands in Pakistan for 1st tour in 24 years, pics surface
3.article_body: Members of the 18-member squad picked for Australian men's cricket team's first trip to Pakistan in 24 years landed in Islamabad during the early hours of Sunday morning. Australia last played in Pakistan in 1998, winning the three-match Test series 1-0 and winning the ODI series 3-0. The upcoming Test series will be Pat Cummins' first overseas series as captain.

4.title: Don't want to be captain just for personal satisfaction, it is just a post: Bumrah
4.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah said he doesn't want to be captain just for personal satisfaction. "It's just a post...it's just a name, you've to do your job and you have to help people in the best way you can," he added. Bumrah further said, "Whatever role is asked of me I'd do it with the best ability that I can."

5.title: 26.11-carat diamond found by man in MP mine sold for ₹1.62 crore
5.article_body: The 26.11-carat diamond found by a brick kiln operator in Madhya Pradesh's Panna district was sold for ₹1.62 crore during an auction, an official said on Sunday. The brick kiln operator had found the diamond in a shallow mine. In the auction, 87 other rough diamonds fetched a total of ₹1.89 crore.

6.title: Russia's actions bear signs of genocide, kids will be killed subtly: Ukrainian Prez
6.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday urged the world to scrap Russia’s voting power at the UN Security Council. He said, "They are going to bomb our Ukrainian cities, even more, they are going to kill our children even more subtly...Russia's criminal actions against Ukraine bear signs of genocide." Russian forces have entered into Ukraine's second-largest city, Kharkiv.

7.title: Ukraine govt shares pic of residential building shelled by Russia near Kyiv
7.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a picture of a residential building shelled by Russian army. "Russia is committing war crimes. Today Russian army shelled a residential building in Bucha...15 km from Kyiv," it wrote. It also said that Russian tanks shot down a bus with civilians in Okhtyrka district of Sumy region.

8.title: Video shows cyclist being hit by explosive in Ukraine amid Russian invasion
8.article_body: CCTV footage has surfaced on social media that showed a cyclist being hit by an explosive in Ukraine amid the Russian invasion. The video showed the person being thrown from his bike after an orange flash was seen, seemingly from an explosive that hit him. Another video of the incident also showed him crawling from his bike before lying still.

9.title: Ukraine's former beauty queen joins fight against Russian troops
9.article_body: Former Miss Grand Ukraine Anastasiia Lenna has joined the fight against the Russian forces. Lenna, who was Ukraine’s 2015 representative in the Miss Grand International beauty contest, shared photos of her holding a gun. She also shared an Instagram Story featuring Ukrainian soldiers and wrote, "Everyone who crosses the Ukrainian border with the intent to invade will be killed!"

10.title: Ajith's 'Valimai' earns ₹100 crore worldwide in 3 days, Huma shares post
10.article_body: Ajith Kumar-starrer 'Valimai' has crossed the ₹100 crore mark at the worldwide box office within three days of its release. Huma Qureshi, who plays a character named Sophia in the action-thriller film, shared a tweet celebrating the film's milestone, writing, "Woo hoo! Thank you for all the love." 'Valimai' is directed by H Vinoth and produced by Boney Kapoor.

11.title: Means a lot to start new life from grandparents' house: Sheetal on wedding
11.article_body: Actress Sheetal Thakur took to Instagram to share video of her Himachal wedding with actor Vikrant Massey and said that it means a lot to her to start her "new life" from her grandparents' house. "It's a village or whatever people call it. But this is me," she said in the video. Sheetal and Vikrant got married on February 18.

12.title: Radhe Shyam makers install free astrology booths in cinema halls across India
12.article_body: The makers of Prabhas-starrer 'Radhe Shyam' have installed astrology booths in a lot of cinema halls across India. Every booth is equipped with an astrologer who'll read the palms of people free of cost. Reportedly, the booths have already been attracting massive crowds across the theatres. In 'Radhe Shyam', Prabhas, too, will be seen essaying the role of a palmist.

13.title: Amrita Rao shares edited 'Vivah' pic to wish Shahid Kapoor on birthday
13.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao took to Instagram to share a photoshopped picture from the movie 'Vivah' to wish her co-star and actor Shahid Kapoor on his birthday. "Happy birthday dear Shahid," she wrote. She reportedly also added the song 'Tum Jiyo Hazaron Saal' to her post. Shahid responded by saying, "Thanks so much, Amrita."

14.title: Shruti Haasan tests COVID +ve, says 'I'm on the mend, will be back soon'
14.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan took to Instagram on Sunday to share that she has tested positive for COVID-19.  "Hi everyone! A quick not so fun update. Despite all safety measures I have tested positive for Covid. I'm on the mend and can't wait to be back very soon," she wrote. Several people wished her a speedy recovery.

15.title: 15 students from Telangana stranded in Ukraine return to Hyderabad
15.article_body: As many as 15 students from Telangana, who were stranded in Ukraine after Russia invaded the country, arrived in Hyderabad on Sunday morning. They were received by Shamshabad MLA Prakash Goud and a local corporator. "As per our information...second batch of students will be repatriated in Delhi. From there, Telangana-Andhra students will come to Hyderabad," DCP of Shamshabad said.

16.title: Words not enough to praise PM Modi’s role amid Ukraine crisis: Rajnath Singh
16.article_body: Campaigning in UP's Bairia, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday hailed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's role amid the Ukraine crisis. "Words are not enough to praise PM Modi for his role," said Singh. He also said, "Earlier, when India used to speak on global stages, the world didn't take it seriously. Now when India speaks, the world pays attention."

17.title: Ishan Kishan discharged from hospital, unlikely to play 3rd T20I
17.article_body: India batter Ishan Kishan, who was hospitalised after he was hit on the helmet by a bouncer during the second T20I against Sri Lanka in Dharamshala, has been discharged. "Kishan is under close observation of BCCI's medical team," a source told ANI. The source added that Kishan is unlikely to play the third T20I against Sri Lanka in Dharamshala.

18.title: Shreyas is aware that he might not start at T20 WC 2022: Karthik
18.article_body: Dinesh Karthik said India batter Shreyas Iyer has guaranteed a strong place in 2022 T20 World Cup squad following his performance in ongoing T20I series against Sri Lanka. "He's aware at...back of his mind...he might not start at...World Cup. But...first step is to put a seat on that flight," he added. Shreyas was adjudged 'Player of Match' in second T20I.

19.title: Finally contributing to team's success means a lot to me: Sanju Samson
19.article_body: India batter Sanju Samson, who batted for the first time in a T20I match since July last year, has said he's happy with his 39-run innings in the second T20I against Sri Lanka. "The rhythm wasn't there for the starting 10-12 balls...So I took a bit of extra time...finally contributing positively to the team's success means a lot," he added.

20.title: Mattress godown gutted in fire in Pune's Pisoli, no one injured
20.article_body: A mattress godown was gutted in a fire in Pune's Pisoli area on Saturday night. No injury was reported as all employees had left the godown in the evening. "We had deployed 10 fire tenders and it took about 2.5 hours to douse the fire," an official said, adding that the building was highly inflammable.

21.title: Chhattisgarh to generate electricity from cattle dung, agricultural waste
21.article_body: The Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) is going to help the Chhattisgarh government generate electricity from cattle dung and agricultural waste. Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel has asked state Principal Secretary Amitabh Jain to submit an action plan in two weeks "for scientific and systematic use of cow urine in the agriculture sector".

22.title: Ghaziabad civic body plans to revive 28 ponds before monsoon
22.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has announced that it plans to revive 28 ponds in its jurisdiction before the arrival of the monsoon this year. The civic body said that it has revived 10 water bodies so far. "The rejuvenation work may not directly help us in getting...drinking water...but it will...help us in...recharging of groundwater resources," the Ghaziabad Municipal Commissioner said.

23.title: Israeli billionaire to give oil, mining assets back to Congo
23.article_body: A company controlled by Israeli billionaire Dan Gertler will give control of valuable mining and oil assets back to Congo, the Congolese government has confirmed. The assets are reportedly estimated to be worth over $2 billion. Notably, the US had imposed sanctions on Gertler and several of his businesses in 2017 and 2018 for alleged corruption in Congo.

24.title: 14 shot at hookah bar in Las Vegas; 1 killed
24.article_body: As many as 14 people were shot at a hookah bar in US' Las Vegas. One of them died while two others are said to be critical. The shootout reportedly began following an altercation between two people at a party. "We're not sure exactly what kind of weapon was used, or if there were two shooters," said police.

25.title: 17,914 street children in India, highest in Maharashtra: NCPCR to SC
25.article_body: There are 17,914 street children or "children in street situations" across India, the National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) told the Supreme Court. The Commission added that Maharashtra has the highest number of children living on the streets at 4,952. Out of 17,914 children, 834 kids live on the streets alone.

26.title: 23-year-old man robbed of mobile phone at knifepoint by 4 men in Pune
26.article_body: A 23-year-old man was allegedly robbed of his mobile phone worth ₹40,000 at knifepoint by four unidentified men in Pune at around 1:30 am on Sunday. The incident reportedly took place when the man was standing and talking on his phone near his parked motorcycle in the Koregaon Park area. A case has been registered against the accused.

27.title: UP is crime, terrorism free; everyone feels safe: Minister Mohsin Raza
27.article_body: Uttar Pradesh minister Mohsin Raza, after casting his vote in Lucknow, said that the state is crime and terrorism free and that "everyone feels safe". "People are getting jobs. We've made UP economy number two and will also make it number one and people are voting for that. We are forming the government," he added.

28.title: 30-yr-old woman kills self in Punjab, blames husband in suicide note
28.article_body: A 30-year-old woman died by suicide in Punjab. She reportedly blamed her husband in her suicide note. The woman alleged that her husband beat her up daily and was responsible for her death. The woman's father said that she had married her husband in 2016 and the couple had a two-year-old daughter. The police have arrested the husband in case.

29.title: Bajrang Dal activist's killing must be treated as act of terror: Tejasvi Surya
29.article_body: BJP MP from Bengaluru South Tejasvi Surya said the Karnataka government must treat the Bajrang Dal activist Harsha's killing in Shivamogga like "an act of terror." A special unit should be set up to deal with such cases as the police alone are inadequate, he added. "Harsha's case must be prosecuted u/s UAPA and investigation must be comprehensive," Surya stated.

30.title: Gang involved in tyre theft busted in Hyd, tyres worth ₹29.64 lakh seized
30.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested three members of a gang involved in the theft of tyres and recovered materials worth ₹44.72 lakh from their possession. Police seized 152 MRF tyres worth ₹29.64 lakh and other things. The gang members did a recce at truck factories and warehouses, and got into loaded vehicles posing as passengers seeking a lift, police said.

31.title: Gujarat's PSI suspended for allowing constables to travel in private car
31.article_body: Gujarat's Bharatnagar police station incharge MS Yadav was suspended from service on Tuesday for allowing the four constables killed in an accident on February 15 to travel in a private car. "We had permitted them to travel by train...the PSI allowed the constables to go to Delhi driving a car belonging to a private person," IGP Ashok Kumar Yadav said.

32.title: EC bans BJP’s UP candidate over 'go to Pakistan' remark
32.article_body: The Election Commission has banned BJP candidate from UP's Tiloi constituency, Mayankeshwar Sharan Singh, from making public statements for 24 hours over inflammatory speech. "If you have to live in India, (you will have) to chant 'Radhey-Radhey'. Otherwise, like all those who went to Pakistan during Partition, you can go too, you are not needed here," Singh had said.

33.title: Tesla Fremont plant toilets had racist symbols writings: Fired worker
33.article_body: A former Tesla employee, Marc Cage, has sued the firm alleging he was fired for reporting widespread safety violations and race discrimination at Tesla's factories. "Virtually every restroom in Tesla's Fremont facility contained writings or carvings of racist symbols and slurs," Cage said. He added Tesla employees denigrated and harassed him, with the knowledge of the management.

34.title: One day he started singing loudly in the hospital: Bappi Lahiri's son
34.article_body: When asked if Bappi Lahiri listened to music in the hospital, the late singer's son Bappa Lahiri said yes, adding, that one day he started singing loudly in the hospital. Bappa said his father was in the hospital for a large part of last month. "On February 14, he...kept saying 'ghar chalo ghar chalo' (Let's go home)," Bappa added.

35.title: Archer is one bowler I would like to face: 19-year-old Yash Dhull
35.article_body: India's 2022 Under-19 World Cup-winning captain Yash Dhull, who's currently playing in the ongoing Ranji Trophy, has said England pacer Jofra Archer is one bowler he would like to face in the future. "I would [also] love to make a partnership with David Warner [during IPL]," he added. Dhull scored twin centuries on his first-class debut for Delhi.

36.title: Muslims not happy with Samajwadi Party, won't vote for them: Mayawati
36.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati said that Muslims are not happy with the Samajwadi Party and will not vote for them. "People of UP have rejected SP even before voting as voting for SP means Gunda raj and Mafia raj. Riots happened in SP government. The face of SP leaders tell that they are not coming in power," she added.

37.title: Worked with dialect coach, had to get Bombaiya accent: Alia on 'Gangubai..'
37.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she started preparing for 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' with "basic technical preparations". "From voice modulation to getting...Gujarati characteristics...I had a dialect coach...Since she spent a lot of time in Mumbai...I had to get some Bombaiya accent," she said, adding, "I feel the actual preparations happen when you start enacting scenes...with try and error."

38.title: Karnataka reports 767 new COVID-19 cases; 552 in Bengaluru alone
38.article_body: Karnataka reported 767 new coronavirus cases on Tuesday, as per data provided by the state health department. Of the new cases, 552 were reported from the state capital, Bengaluru, alone. The state also reported 29 more coronavirus-related deaths, out of which 14 were reported from Bengaluru. The total number of active coronavirus cases in the city has risen to 5,255.

39.title: World's richest man Elon Musk dating 27-yr-old actress Natasha Bassett: Reports
39.article_body: Elon Musk, the 50-year-old Tesla CEO who's the world's richest man, is dating 27-year-old Australian actress Natasha Bassett, reports said. A few days ago, she was photographed leaving Musk's private jet in Los Angeles. Musk and Bassett were friends first and began dating after Musk's split with Canadian singer Grimes, with whom he had his son 'X Æ A-Xii'.

40.title: Rainfall warning issued for 19 states/UTs over next five days, list released
40.article_body: IMD has said that widespread rainfall is very likely over J&K, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand during next two days and scattered rainfall for subsequent three days. Other states/UTs which may see rainfall over next five days are Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand, Odisha, West Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Assam, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura.

41.title: Putin is a 'genius', he is 'very savvy': Trump on Putin's Ukraine move
41.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has called Russian President Vladimir Putin a "genius" for his decision to recognise two breakaway Ukrainian regions as independent. "Here's a guy who's very savvy...I know him very well," Trump added. Accusing US President Joe Biden of being "weak", Trump said, "This never would have happened had I been in office."

42.title: Russia's richest people lose $32 billion this year amid Ukraine crisis
42.article_body: The net worth of Russia's 23 billionaires has fallen by $32 billion to $343 billion so far this year amid the Ukraine crisis, as per Bloomberg. Gennady Timchenko, who's a close ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin, has seen his wealth disappear by almost a third this year. Meanwhile, Novatek shareholder Leonid Mikhelson's fortune has fallen by $6.2 billion.

43.title: Voting underway on 59 seats across 9 districts in 4th phase of UP Assembly polls
43.article_body: Voting for 59 Assembly constituencies spread across nine districts of Uttar Pradesh began at 7 am on Wednesday in the fourth phase of the polls and will continue till 6 pm. The fourth phase of polling will decide the fate of 624 candidates of Pilibhit, Lakhimpur Kheri, Sitapur, Hardoi, Unnao, Lucknow, Raebareli, Banda and Fatehpur.

44.title: HC issues notice to Delhi govt over PIL against CCTVs inside classrooms
44.article_body: Delhi High Court on Tuesday issued a notice to the Delhi government asking it to reply to a PIL challenging the decision to install CCTV cameras inside classrooms of Delhi schools and the consequent live-streaming of such video footage to third persons. The installation of CCTVs in classrooms without consent violates the right to privacy, the PIL states.

45.title: US imposes sanctions on Russian banks, elites; Biden says 'Invasion of Ukraine has begun'
45.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday said that the country was imposing a first tranche of sanctions against Russia, adding, "This is the beginning of a Russian invasion of Ukraine." Biden said the sanctions applied to VEB bank and Russia's military bank - Promsvyazbank, which does defence deals. Sanctions were also imposed against Russian elites and their family members.

46.title: Employee runs away with ₹14 lakh from gas agency in Pune, booked
46.article_body: An employee of a gas agency has been booked by Pune Police for allegedly running away with  ₹14,13,160 from agency. The employee was reportedly asked to deposit the money in the bank. A 43-year-old man, who owns the gas agency, filed a complaint in the case. A case under Sections 406 and 381 of Indian Penal Code has been registered.

47.title: 12-yr-old boy falls from terrace of 7-storey building in Mumbai, dies
47.article_body: A 12-year-old boy died after falling from the terrace of a seven-storey building in Mumbai's Vashi on Monday. He was playing on a trampoline kept on the building terrace when he lost control and fell on the ground floor, police said. The boy, who suffered multiple fractures, was taken to a hospital, however, doctors declared him dead during the treatment.

48.title: Wife kills husband over her illicit affair with tenant in Delhi; held
48.article_body: A woman killed her husband over an alleged illicit affair she was having with their family's tenant in Delhi's Rithala. Police arrested the accused, identified as Seema, and six other people for plotting and killing the victim. One of the six people arrested included the tenant, Gaurav Teotia, who was found to have been involved with Seema for eight years.

49.title: BBMP imposes ₹6 lakh fine as 200kg single-use plastic seized in B'luru
49.article_body: The BBMP has carried out surprise inspections at plastic production units and shops selling single-use plastic in Bengaluru. During the inspection, BBMP seized 200 kg single-use plastic from a plastic-producing unit and imposed a fine of ₹6,00,000 on it. Notably, single-use plastic is completely banned in Bengaluru and therefore, penalties are being levied on shops that are violating this order.

50.title: US women’s football team reaches $24 million settlement over equal pay
50.article_body: Players from the US women's football team (USWNT) on Tuesday reached a $24 million settlement with the US Soccer Federation (USSF), plus bonuses that match the men's team, ending a six-year battle over equal pay. USSF agreed to provide equal pay rates to both men's and women's teams, including World Cup bonuses. The USWNT have won four FIFA World Cups.

51.title: Very tough to quickly replace Russian gas supplies to Europe: Qatar
51.article_body: Qatar's Energy Minister said that neither Qatar nor any other single country has the capacity to replace Russian gas supplies to Europe with LNG in the event of disruption due to Ukrainian conflict. "Russia (provides) I think 30-40% of the supply to Europe," he added. "So, to replace that sum of volume that quickly is almost impossible," he further said.

52.title: 3 police officers injured as COVID-19 protest turns violent in NZ
52.article_body: Police on Tuesday said a protester against COVID-19 mandates in New Zealand drove their car towards lines of police, with three officers taken to hospital after being sprayed with an unknown "stinging" substance. Protesters, inspired by Canada's 'Freedom Convoy', have camped near Wellington's Parliament for two weeks. "What's happening in Wellington is wrong," Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said.

53.title: Omicron led to more COVID-19 deaths in US than Delta: Reports
53.article_body: The Seattle Times on Saturday reported that the Omicron variant of COVID-19 led to more deaths in the United States than those recorded during the Delta wave. The US has reported over 1,54,750 deaths since November 24, some 22,000 deaths more than the 1,32,616 reported during the worst of the Delta wave between August 1 and October 31, 2021.

54.title: 9 arrested by police after Leeds Utd's match with Man Utd in PL
54.article_body: Police on Monday said nine people were arrested following Leeds United's Premier League match with Manchester United on Sunday. Manchester United's Anthony Elanga appeared to be hit by an object thrown from the crowd. "Officers were deployed in sufficient numbers to rapidly intervene to identify and arrest the people responsible and prevent any escalation in disorder," West Yorkshire Police said.

55.title: Govt tracking crude prices to decide possible cut in fuel tax: FM
55.article_body: Government is keeping an eye on geopolitical developments affecting crude oil prices to take a call on a possible duty cut in fuel prices, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. This comes after Brent crude touched its seven-year high of $99.50/barrel amid rising Russia-Ukraine tensions. Indian fuel prices have remained unchanged for over two months despite rise in global oil prices.

56.title: PMJJBY subscribers not eligible for shares at discounted rates: LIC
56.article_body: Subscribers of Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY) are ineligible for shares at a discounted price in the upcoming LIC IPO, the insurer clarified on Tuesday. "It is a group insurance product and [PMJJBY policyholders] aren't eligible," LIC said in a statement. This comes after LIC Chairman MR Kumar on Monday said PMJJBY subscribers are eligible for discounted shares.

57.title: 'America's Got Talent' contestant Jane Marczewski dies due to cancer aged 31
57.article_body: Singer Jane Marczewski, who gained widespread recognition after her audition last year on 'America's Got Talent', died on February 19 at the age of 31 after a prolonged battle with cancer. Known by her stage name 'Nightbirde', Marczewski battled cancer for four years. "We, her family, are devastated by her passing and unimaginable loss," her family stated.

58.title: Koladiya not even an employee, used 'foul language' on a call: BharatPe's Ashneer
58.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover in a letter to the board of Resilient Innovations, the parent of BharatPe, accused Bhavik Koladiya, one of BharatPe's original Co-founders, of using "foul language" on a call with him. In the letter seen by Moneycontrol, Ashneer said, "Koladiya is neither a Member of the Board nor an employee of the Company."

59.title: US spy planes seen circling over Ukraine amid tensions with Russia: Flight tracker
59.article_body: Two US spy planes have travelled on regular missions to Ukraine and navigated in repeated loops in the largely empty airspace over the past month, as per flight tracker Flightradar24. Their flights have coincided with a military build-up by Russia along the Ukrainian border. Aviation watchers speculated that the US is making its presence known in a show of force.

60.title: Want to do films that make my heart skip a beat: Alia Bhatt
60.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said she wants to be part of movies that "make her heart skip a beat". "I will do a film that gives me energy every time I wake [up], a film that makes me want to rush to sets," Alia said. She also said her next 10-year plan is to build her production house.

61.title: Men need to understand women are much stronger: Madhavan
61.article_body: R Madhavan, speaking about gender equality, said, "Men need to understand a simple rule...physically and mentally, women are much stronger as you grow older." To back his statement, Madhavan said in many households, grandmothers are the last ones standing compared to grandfathers. He added, "It'll work well for men if they...invest in their future by being understanding to...ladies in...house."

62.title: Assam govt employee arrested after being caught accepting bribe
62.article_body: A team from Assam Police's Vigilance and Anti-Corruption cell on Tuesday arrested a health department employee in Tezpur for allegedly accepting a bribe. The team had laid a trap on the basis of a complaint following which the accused Bhupen Borah was caught red-handed. Borah had demanded the bribe from the complainant for providing the Form-16 Certificate, police said.

63.title: Romania preparing to take in 5 lakh Ukrainian refugees: Defence Min
63.article_body: Romanian Defence Minister Vasile Dîncu on Tuesday said that Romania is preparing to receive up to 5 lakh potential refugees from Ukraine in case of a Russian invasion. "There is a plan prepared for all large cities, there are areas for this near the borders," he added. This comes after Russia recognised two breakaway Ukrainian regions as independent.

64.title: Shaheen Afridi, you beauty: Shahid Afridi after Shaheen slams 3 sixes in last over
64.article_body: After Lahore Qalandars captain Shaheen Afridi smashed three sixes and a four in last over of their PSL 2022 match against Peshawar Zalmi, Shahid Afridi tweeted, "Shaheen Afridiiii you beautyyy!!!" Shahid also shared a collage showing Shaheen's celebration from the match and a similar throwback picture of himself. Shaheen's effort helped his team take the match to the Super Over.

65.title: Excited to work with Akshay Kumar in 'Bade Miyan...': Tiger Shroff
65.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff said that he is excited to work in his upcoming film 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' as it gives him a chance to work with actor Akshay Kumar. "My father always tells me to follow his example...I know I've been his fan for as long as I can remember." The film will be directed by Ali Abbas Zafar.

66.title: Usual nonsense: Deverakonda on marriage rumours with Rashmika
66.article_body: Telugu actor Vijay Deverakonda has denied rumours of marrying actress Rashmika Mandanna. "As usual nonsense," he wrote on Twitter. "Don't we just (heart emoji) da news!" he added. Some media reports had claimed the duo were tying the knot soon. "I presume this must be the end to the pseudo journalism," a fan wrote in response to the actor's tweet.

67.title: Opp'n looted country in name of 'garibi hatao', samajwad: PM Modi
67.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while campaigning in Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday, attacked the opposition saying, they looted the country in the name of "garibi hatao (remove poverty) and samajwad (socialism)". Further hitting out at Samajwadi Party for terming COVID-19 vaccine as 'BJP's Vaccine,' he said, "Just like you didn't hear them for vaccines, do not hear them for votes as well."

68.title: He's world-class player: David on playing under Rohit-led MI in IPL 2022
68.article_body: Mumbai Indians' new signing Tim David said he's excited to bat alongside Kieron Pollard, adding it'll be a huge bonus for him to spend time with "world-class player" and captain Rohit Sharma in IPL 2022. "Rohit just looks so effortless when he bats...very admirable," he added. The Singapore all-rounder was bought for ₹8.25 crore in IPL mega auction 2022.

69.title: Ireland to drop most of its remaining COVID-19 curbs on February 28
69.article_body: Ireland has said it will drop most of its remaining COVID-19 restrictions from February 28 onwards. The relaxation of curbs will include an end to physical distancing measures in schools, scaling back of COVID-19 testing and lifting of legal mandate requiring people to wear masks. "Current epidemiological profile of COVID-19 in Ireland is broadly stable," the government said.

70.title: Important for India to be strong: PM amid Ukraine-Russia conflict
70.article_body: Amid the escalating Ukraine-Russia conflict, PM Narendra Modi said, "It is imperative for India to be strong for itself and for the entire human race." There is a lot of turmoil in the world right now, he added. "Today, your every vote will make India stronger and help further strengthen the country," he further said.

71.title: Bulk of medicines found discarded in Bihar hospital; probe on
71.article_body: A large number of assorted medicines were allegedly found discarded at an almost inaccessible corner of a Bihar hospital. The discovery, which also included several medicines discarded before its expiration date, was made during a sting operation conducted by Times Now at Sadar Hospital, Hajipur. An immediate enquiry was ordered by Vaishali Civil Surgeon Dr Akhilesh Mohan.

72.title: 6 EU nations send team to help Ukraine deal with cyber threats
72.article_body: Six European Union (EU) countries, including Lithuania, Netherlands, Poland, Estonia, Romania and Croatia, have sent a team of cybersecurity experts to Ukraine to help deal with cyber threats amid tensions with Russia. The US and the UK on Friday had said that Russian military hackers were behind recent cyberattacks on Ukraine. However, Russia has denied any role in the cyberattacks.

73.title: Sanjeev Sanyal joins PM's Economic Advisory Council as full-time member
73.article_body: Noted economist Sanjeev Sanyal has been inducted as a full-time member of the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM), the council's Chairman Bibek Debroy announced on Tuesday. Prior to this, Sanyal was serving as the Principal Economic Advisor in the Finance Ministry. The EAC-PM is an independent body that advises the Prime Minister on economic and related issues.

74.title: Australia announce 16-member white-ball squad for Pakistan tour
74.article_body: Australia have named a 16-player squad for the white-ball leg of their tour of Pakistan, with David Warner, Pat Cummins, Josh Hazlewood, Mitchell Starc and Glenn Maxwell to miss the leg. Aaron Finch will lead the side, which also includes Sean Abbott, Mitchell Marsh, Kane Richardson, Steve Smith, Marcus Stoinis and Adam Zampa.

75.title: Assumed my role was finished after 'Captain America...': Sebastian
75.article_body: Hollywood actor Sebastian Stan has said he had assumed that his role was finished after 'Captain America: The First Avenger'. "I certainly did not know that I would be playing the role for 10 years," he said in an interview. "I remember...being told about this role. But it didn't seem like there was any commitment, really," Sebastian added.

76.title: Rajnath Singh's speech in UP disrupted by youths, 1 man detained
76.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh's election speech was disrupted by some youths in UP's Ballia on Tuesday who claimed that Army recruitment is on hold for three years. Singh responded saying the process was underway, adding that things take wrong turn when politics is brought in. Meanwhile, a man was detained during the rally for raising 'Akhilesh Yadav zindabad' slogan.

77.title: Only PM Modi had the will to revoke it: JP Nadda on triple talaq
77.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria, BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda said that only "PM Narendra Modi Ji had the will to revoke the 13th-century practice" of triple talaq. "Supreme Court had ordered abolishing the triple talaq practice but nobody acted on it because of the politics of appeasement," he further said.

78.title: Dombivli ward boy molests 75-yr-old woman while taking X-ray, held
78.article_body: A 22-year-old private hospital's ward boy has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 75-year-old woman twice while she was being taken for a chest X-ray. Dombivli Ramnagar police officials said the accused was identified as Kanadas Vaishnav. The victim was allegedly touched inappropriately while being given instructions for standing for the X-ray by Vaishnav in Dombivli, Maharashtra, on Monday.

79.title: DMK gets majority in Chennai by winning 153 wards in TN urban local polls
79.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin-led DMK on Tuesday won 153 wards out of 200 in Chennai in urban local body polls. Congress won 13 wards and AIADMK won 15 wards. BJP settled for one ward and CPI(M) won four wards. "I will work to maintain the trust that people have placed in me," tweeted Stalin after the results.

80.title: Dubsmash shuts down seven years after its launch
80.article_body: American short-form video social platform Dubsmash officially shuts down on February 22, 2022, a little more than seven years after its launch. Reddit, which acquired Dubsmash in December 2020, is shutting the platform after absorbing much of its functionality. Dubsmash will no longer be available for download in the Apple App Store or Google Play Store.

81.title: Man who pushed wife to death after taking selfie in Turkey suing people for insulting him
81.article_body: A 41-year-old man who pushed his pregnant wife off a cliff in Turkey to claim their accident insurance is suing hundreds of people for damages for allegedly insulting him on social media. He's reportedly seeking around ₹27,000 from each person who insulted him. The man, who is serving life imprisonment, had clicked a selfie with his wife before killing her.

82.title: Perry put lot of pressure on himself during 'Friends': Co-star Cox
82.article_body: Actress Courteney Cox has said his 'Friends' co-star Matthew Perry had put a lot of pressure on himself while playing Chandler Bing in the sitcom. "That's a lot to think how much he relied on that for his own self-worth," Cox said. Last year, Perry had admitted that the audience's reaction to his performance greatly affected his mental health.

83.title: Mumbai logs 135 COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths in the last 24 hrs
83.article_body: Mumbai reported 135 new COVID-19 cases and two related deaths in the last 24 hours. Moreover, 233 COVID-19 recoveries were reported in Mumbai, with the city currently having 1,315 active cases. Maharashtra reported 1,080 fresh COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, taking the overall infection tally in the state to 78,60,317. Active cases in the state stand at 13,070.

84.title: Delhi reports 498 COVID-19 cases & 1 death in the last 24 hrs
84.article_body: Delhi reported 498 new COVID-19 cases and one related death in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,57,015. Moreover, 411 recoveries were reported in the national capital, with the city currently having 2,367 active cases. With one more death, the fatality count in Delhi has reached 26,106.

85.title: I'll be with Argentina squad at 2022 World Cup in Qatar: Aguero
85.article_body: Sergio Aguero, who retired from professional football in December 2021, has revealed that he will be part of Argentina's backroom staff at the 2022 World Cup in Qatar. The 33-year-old former striker  made this announcement after a meeting with Argentine Football Association (AFA) President Claudio Tapia on Monday. Aguero was forced to quit the sport due to a heart condition.

86.title: Air India flight from Ukraine with 240 on board to land in Delhi tonight
86.article_body: An Air India plane carrying over 240 passengers from Ukraine is expected to land in Delhi on Tuesday night, officials said. The flight took off from Boryspil International Airport in Kyiv at around 6 pm, the officials said. The Indian embassy in Kyiv on Tuesday again asked Indian students to temporarily leave Ukraine amid the rising tensions.

87.title: Gives huge confidence: Praggnanandhaa on beating world champion Carlsen
87.article_body: Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa, who became third Indian to beat Magnus Carlsen, said the win against world number one gives him "huge confidence". The 16-year-old defeated world champion in eighth round of ongoing Airthings Masters. "It was very hard because...game starts early morning at 3 am. I prepared for it everyday by changing my routine to the tournament's schedule," he added.

88.title: Saudi Arabia marks nearly 300-yr-old 'Founding Day' for first time
88.article_body: Saudi Arabia held celebrations on Tuesday to commemorate its foundation nearly 300 years ago for the first time. The celebratory events included musical performances on Saudi modern history and fireworks, local media has reported. February 22 marks the anniversary of the day in 1727 when Mohammed bin Saud, who was founder of first Saudi state, took over emirate of Diriyah.

89.title: Hungary to deploy troops near Ukrainian border amid crisis: Govt
89.article_body: Hungarian Defence Ministry on Tuesday announced deployment of an unspecified number of troops near Ukrainian border for security and humanitarian tasks. Hungary's security is most important, we are reinforcing the border, ministry said. This comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered "peacekeeping operation" in Ukraine's breakaway regions after recognising their independence on Monday.

90.title: Woman cleans window standing on railing of building in Ghaziabad, video viral
90.article_body: A video of a woman cleaning a windowpane while standing on a railing of a highrise building in Ghaziabad has surfaced online. As per reports, the woman is a resident of the Shipra Riviera Society and the woman who filmed the incident tried to call her several times but the woman was busy cleaning the windowpane.

91.title: Sharad Pawar seeks time to appear before Koregaon-Bhima panel
91.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar, who was to appear before the Koregaon-Bhima Inquiry Commission on February 23 and 24, has submitted an application before it seeking more time. He'll definitely appear in the future to record his version of events, NCP spokesperson Nawab Malik said. The panel, which is probing the 2018 violence, had summoned Pawar to depose as a witness.

92.title: Drugs worth ₹51.83 crore seized in Mizoram in 2021-22: Governor
92.article_body: Mizoram Governor Hari Babu Kambhampati on Tuesday said that the police seized narcotic substances valued at ₹51.83 crore in 2021-22. Altogether 2,112 people were arrested in narcotic drugs and prohibition related cases during the financial year, he added. The government is making all-out efforts to curb drug trafficking, Kambhampati further said.

93.title: This is an election to save democracy, change fate of UP: Akhilesh
93.article_body: While addressing a rally at Bhirpur in Yamunapar's Karchana assembly constituency in Uttar Pradesh, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said this election is to save the democracy and change the fate of Uttar Pradesh. "We will work to implement the SP manifesto. Ever since the BJP government came, inflation and unemployment have increased," he further added.

94.title: Ex-Aus head coach Langer would be good fit as England head coach: Gilchrist
94.article_body: Ex-Australia wicketkeeper-batter Adam Gilchrist said Justin Langer would be a "good fit" for the role of head coach for England team. Langer resigned as Australia head coach recently, while Chris Silverwood was sacked by ECB after England's 0-4 Ashes series loss against Australia. "Langer has been hurt, you don't need to be (Albert) Einstein to work that out," Gilchrist added.

95.title: No third front can fight BJP without Cong: Mehbooba Mufti
95.article_body: While winding up her five-day tour of Jammu province, former J&K Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti said no third front or political alliance can fight BJP without the Congress. Congress has played an important role in building the nation over the last 70 years and there is no alternative to it, she further added.

96.title: 5 lakh cigarettes worth ₹48 lakh seized at Kolkata Airport
96.article_body: Nearly five lakh cigarettes worth ₹48 lakh have been seized by customs officials from a domestic cargo complex at Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport in Kolkata. A customs official said the action was taken based on a specific intelligence input on Monday, following which a flight from Dimapur was intercepted. The official added that a case was lodged.

97.title: Yemen's Houthis launch drone attack on Saudi airport, 16 hurt: Report
97.article_body: Saudi Arabia's state-run news agency said 16 people were injured at King Abdullah Bin Abdulaziz Airport in Saudi city of Jizan on Monday after a drone carrying explosives launched by Iran-backed Houthis was intercepted and destroyed. This comes after 12 people were injured in a similar attack by Houthis at Abha International Airport less than two weeks ago.

98.title: American singer Keke Wyatt pregnant with 11th child, shares baby bump pics
98.article_body: American singer Keke Wyatt announced she's expecting her 11th baby. "My husband, Zackariah David Darring and I are proud to announce that our family will be adding a 'plus 1' to the Wyatt Bunch!" she wrote while mentioning that one of her daughters is missing from the family photo. The 39-year-old was previously married to Michael Ford and Rahmat Morton.

99.title: Putin allowed to use troops abroad after sending them to rebel Ukraine regions
99.article_body: After formally recognising two eastern Ukrainian rebel-held regions, Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday asked the upper house of parliament for permission to use Russia's armed forces abroad. Members then voted unanimously to allow Putin to use military force outside Russia. Russian troops were earlier moved into the Donetsk and Luhansk regions that broke away from Ukraine in 2014.

100.title: Centre extends PM CARES for Children Scheme till February 28
100.article_body: The Centre on Tuesday announced that the PM CARES for Children Scheme has been extended till February 28, 2022. The Union Ministry of Women and Child Development said that all eligible children can be registered for the scheme till the extended date to avail its benefits. The scheme was previously valid till December 31, 2021.

101.title: Bengal CM writes to PM Modi on Ganga erosion issue, seeks help
101.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has sought Centre's help to check land erosion on banks of river Ganga in three districts. In a letter to the PM, she urged him to intervene so that flood management schemes can start at the earliest. She also mentioned that erosion following the Farakka barrage construction led to loss of properties and agricultural land.

102.title: Students, police clash at protests in Kolkata over Anish Khan's death
102.article_body: Hundreds of students and police clashed during students' protests in Kolkata over the alleged killing of student activist Anish Khan. Students of Aliah University were going to submit a deputation to Minister of Minority Affairs Ghulam Rabbani at Writers’ Building. Khan's family has alleged that four people in police uniforms pushed him from third floor of his house in Howrah.

103.title: Alliance with BJP in Manipur has been challenging: NPP chief Sangma
103.article_body: Speaking about the National People's Party (NPP) coalition with the BJP in Manipur, party president and Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said that it has been "very, very challenging". "It’s not necessary that everything's rosy in a coalition," he added. He further said that whether they will form an alliance again after the state assembly elections will depend on the numbers.

104.title: ₹2-lakh aid for families of Himachal factory blast victims: PM
104.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday announced a compensation of ₹2 lakh for the families of each of those killed in a factory explosion in Himachal Pradesh's Una district. The Prime Minister's Office (PMO) said ₹50,000 will be given to the injured. The money will be given from the Prime Minister's National Relief Fund, the PMO said.

105.title: He deserves happiness on 58th b'day: Parineeti on Sooraj Barjatya
105.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra, speaking about director Sooraj Barjatya's 58th birthday, said, "He deserves all the happiness and love on his birthday because through his films, he has spread so much love and joy to people." Parineeti has worked with him in the upcoming film 'Uunchai'. Parineeti further said that she learned a lot while working with him.

106.title: Abhishek is contemporary actor with depth of traditional era: Balki
106.article_body: Talking about actor Abhishek Bachchan, director R Balki said, "He is one of the rare contemporary actors with depth that is normally associated with a traditional era." Balki is directing Abhishek in 'Ghoomer', which is their second collaboration after the 2009 film 'Paa'. As per reports, Abhishek will play a cricket coach to actress Saiyami Kher in the film.

107.title: Weeks ago there were 3 successful tennis players, now only 1: Becker on Nadal
107.article_body: Six-time Grand Slam champion Boris Becker said Rafael Nadal is the most successful tennis player in history after his record-breaking 21st Grand Slam title at Australian Open last month. "Something that should be highlighted, since a few weeks ago there were three and now there is only one," he added. Nadal broke a tie with Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic.

108.title: Youth beaten up, killed by unidentified goons in Raj; FIR lodged
108.article_body: A youth has died after allegedly being thrashed by an unidentified group of miscreants in Sikar, Rajasthan, on Sunday. The victim, identified as Mukesh Kumar, was reportedly attacked and seriously injured while he was heading back home after closing a repair shop he worked at. According to police, the victim's family has filed a murder case against the accused.

109.title: Singer Sam Hunt's pregnant wife files for divorce, cites adultery
109.article_body: Country singer-songwriter Sam Hunt's pregnant wife Hannah Lee Fowler on Friday filed for divorce citing inappropriate marital conduct and adultery after almost five years of marriage. Hannah is due to deliver their first child in May and alleged that Sam cheated on her during the pregnancy. She has reportedly demanded alimony, child support and primary custody of their soon-to-be-born child.

110.title: Hyd Police find missing woman from Visakhapatnam, serve her tea
110.article_body: Hyderabad Police helped a missing elderly woman from Visakhapatnam after spotting her roaming in the area they were present at. The patrolling officers immediately informed the Karkhana police station for further action to help identify the woman. SHO of Karkhana, Sri B Ravinder, shared pictures of the woman sitting on a bench and being served tea by an officer.

111.title: I'm a legit businessman, gained wealth through Bitcoin: Alleged 'Tinder Swindler'
111.article_body: Shimon Hayut, accused in the documentary 'The Tinder Swindler', of conning women out of $430,000 after becoming romantically involved with them, has denied being a conman, saying he's a "legit businessman". On being asked how he funds his lavish lifestyle, he said he acquired his wealth through investment in Bitcoin in 2011. He denied posing as a diamond mogul's son.

112.title: Woman delivers on UP hospital's floor as staff deny admission; baby dies
112.article_body: A pregnant woman delivered her baby on the floor of a hospital in Uttar Pradesh allegedly after staff members demanded a diagnostic report from her and refused to admit her. The incident, which happened in Saharanpur district, led to the death of the newborn. The relatives of the woman have now alleged medical negligence over the incident.

113.title: 54 apps were banned as they were causing harm: Sitharaman
113.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said apps get banned because "they are found being deleterious" in one way or another. "We have banned apps earlier also, like in 2020," Sitharaman said while talking about the recent ban on 54 apps by the Central government. "Trades continue on the requirement of importers," she added.

114.title: Differently-abled man killed by wild elephant in Chhattisgarh forest
114.article_body: A differently-abled man was trampled to death by a wild elephant after his car broke down in the middle of a forest in Chhattisgarh. While the victim, identified as 55-year-old Dhana, was killed as he tried to push his car in Surajpur district on Monday, his acquaintance managed to escape from the spot. The two were returning to their village.

115.title: 1 killed, another injured in landslide in Himachal's Lahaul-Spiti
115.article_body: A 47-year-old person was killed and another person got injured in a landslide in the Lahaul-Spiti district of Himachal Pradesh, a state disaster management official said. The incident took place on Tuesday near the Jungle camp at Tindi in Udaipur, the official said. Meanwhile, the injured person has been admitted to a community health centre for treatment, he added.

116.title: Kannada RJ Rachana passes away at 39 due to cardiac arrest in Bengaluru
116.article_body: Kannada radio jockey (RJ) Rachana passed away on Tuesday at the age of 39, reportedly due to a cardiac arrest. Local media said Rachana complained of chest pain at her flat in Bengaluru and she was rushed to a nearby hospital, where she was declared brought dead. She also appeared in the Kannada film 'Simple Agi Ondh Love Story'.

117.title: Sri Lanka returns 3,000 tonnes of garbage including body parts, mattresses to UK
117.article_body: Sri Lanka has returned 3,000 tonnes of illegally imported waste to the UK, officials said. This was last of several hundred containers filled with garbage from Britain that arrived in Sri Lanka between 2017 and 2019 and was listed as "used mattresses, carpets and rugs". However, they also contained bio-waste from hospitals, including body parts from mortuaries, customs officials said.

118.title: UK woman whose boss shouted she 'must be in her menopause' wins ₹20 lakh payout
118.article_body: A 54-year-old woman named Leigh Best has been awarded over £20,000 (over ₹20 lakh) payout by an employment tribunal in the UK after her boss allegedly shouted she 'must be in her menopause'. The incident happened in March 2020 when her boss made the remark following an argument over an order mix-up. She was fired in May 2020.

119.title: 5 found with leopard skin in car in Chhattisgarh; 3 arrested
119.article_body: Three people were arrested after police seized leopard skin from their car in Chhattisgarh's Rajnandgaon district, while two other accused escaped into the jungles, police said on Tuesday. Their vehicle was intercepted by jawans of Salhewara police station on Monday night, said Superintendent of Police (Rajnandgaon) Santosh Kumar Singh. The accused were entering the state to look for a buyer.

120.title: Criminals, terrorists, mafia, corruption are Akhilesh's friends: BJP
120.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Tuesday alleged SP chief Akhilesh Yadav has "four friends" – criminals, terrorists, mafia and corruption. "When the first list of candidates of SP was released...those in jail and those...on bail were seen on it," Anurag said. "We have asked many questions to Akhilesh...but he is completely silent on them," Anurag said.

121.title: Smriti, Jemimah retained by The Hundred teams in £31,250 top pay bracket
121.article_body: Smriti Mandhana (Southern Brave) and Jemimah Rodrigues (Northern Superchargers) are the two Indians who have been retained by their respective franchises for the 2022 edition of The Hundred. Both Mandhana and Rodrigues are in the top pay bracket of £31,250. Harmanpreet Kaur, Shafali Verma and Deepti Sharma have been released and will be available for selection by other teams.

122.title: EC allows rallies at full capacity with permission in UP & Manipur
122.article_body: Election Commission has revised COVID-19 rules for poll-bound Manipur and Uttar Pradesh, saying that roadshows and rallies will be allowed at full capacity with permission from district authorities. "Restriction of using only 50% capacity of space has been relaxed," EC said. It added that the maximum number of COVID-19 cases are being reported from states where polls aren't being held.

123.title: Never wanted to be controversial, public made me: Munawar on Lock Upp
123.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui, speaking about being a part of Kangana Ranaut's reality television show 'Lock Upp: Badass Jail, Atyaachaari Khel', has said that he never wanted to be controversial and was happy doing comedy. "The part of my video that had hurt people, I removed it immediately...The public...played it around for a year and made it news," the comedian added.

124.title: Centre grants extension of 2 months to delimitation panel on J&K
124.article_body: Centre on Monday granted a two-month extension to delimitation panel mandated to redraw Jammu and Kashmir's electoral constituencies. The panel's term has been extended till May 6, which was slated to expire on March 6. The panel's draft proposal, which had suggested overhaul of Lok Sabha and Assembly constituencies had evoked strong reactions from various J&K political parties, including BJP.

125.title: No tourist activities in Kaziranga on Feb 26, 27 for Prez's visit
125.article_body: In view of President Ram Nath Kovind's proposed visit to Assam's Kaziranga National Park, all tourist activities in two ranges of the park will be closed on February 26 and 27. This will be applicable for Western Range in Bagori and Kaziranga Range in Kohora. Elephant and jeep safaris will not be allowed during the period.

126.title: Homes in Tehri develop cracks, residents demand quick rehabilitation
126.article_body: Homes in Uttarakhand's Tehri have developed cracks and triggered fears among residents that they could cave in due to land subsidence around the Tehri hydropower project. One of the residents of Luneta Bhattkhanda village said a part of his house was damaged on Friday, adding, "We could've been buried in...rubble." The residents are now demanding speedy rehabilitation and financial compensation.

127.title: Vikrant Massey & Sheetal Thakur make 1st appearance after their wedding
127.article_body: Actors Vikrant Massey and Sheetal Thakur made their first public appearance as they returned to Mumbai after getting married in Himachal Pradesh on February 18. In the pictures that surfaced online, Vikrant was seen wearing a white shirt and brown pants while Sheetal wore a grey salwar suit. They had reportedly registered their marriage in Mumbai last week.

128.title: New petition filed against 'Gangubai...' over racial remarks in trailer
128.article_body: A new petition has been filed in Bombay High Court against 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' alleging the use of racial remarks in the trailer. This is the third petition filed against the Alia Bhatt-starrer. Earlier, Gangubai's adopted son had filed a petition claiming that his "mother has been turned into a prostitute". Another plea seeks to censor the name of Kamathipura area.

129.title: Slack suffers second outage within 13 hours, users unable to access app
129.article_body: Workplace chat app Slack is down for several users on Tuesday with some reporting difficulties in sending messages, while others are unable to access the platform. Acknowledging that users may be experiencing issues, Slack tweeted, "We'll provide an...update once we have more information. We're sorry for the disruption." This is the second outage Slack has suffered within 13 hours.

130.title: 573 migrants rescued at sea by Italian coastguard, one found dead
130.article_body: The Italian coastguard on Tuesday said 573 migrants were saved near the southern coast of Italy from two fishing boats in distress due to bad weather, adding that one body was found. The migrants were rescued by three coastguard units that transferred them into another vessel. Amongst the migrants rescued, 59 were minors, many of them unaccompanied.

131.title: UK, Baltic states to conduct military drills amid Ukraine crisis
131.article_body: British Defence Minister Ben Wallace on Tuesday said British-led Joint Expeditionary Force (JEF) comprising of 10 countries including Baltic states will conduct preventive military exercises at sea, on land and in the air in Northern Europe. This comes amid rising tensions between the West and Russia over Ukraine. Wallace added exercises will demonstrate freedom of JEF nations in Baltic Sea.

132.title: Ram Rahim gets Z-plus security cover due to threat on life: Officials
132.article_body: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh has been given Z-plus security cover by the Haryana government, officials said on Tuesday. "There are reliable inputs, regarding the threat to...Singh from pro-Khalistan activists," a recent communication read. A rape and murder convict, Singh was released on a 21-day furlough on February 7. His security detail comprises 55 officers.

133.title: EU countries agree to relax COVID-19 curbs for vaccinated foreigners
133.article_body: European Union member states on Tuesday agreed to relax COVID-19 curbs to facilitate travel to the 27-nation bloc for vaccinated foreigners. European Council recommended lifting of all testing requirements next month for people who received EU-authorised vaccines. However, those who received vaccines which are approved by WHO but not EU-authorised will be asked to procure negative RT-PCR test.

134.title: Djokovic is among favourites to win Laureus World Sportsman: Boris
134.article_body: Boris Becker said Novak Djokovic is among clear favourites to win the Laureus World Sportsman 2022 award. "Djokovic had an incredible 2021, winning three of the four Grand Slams, he came very close to completing the Grand Slam at the US Open but lost to Daniil Medvedev," Boris stated. Djokovic had won the award in 2019.

135.title: Baltic calm despite Ukrainian crisis: Finland's President
135.article_body: Finland's President Sauli Niinistö said that despite Russia's actions in Ukraine, he hasn't seen an increase in Russian military activity in the Baltic Sea. Niinistö also said that he doesn't currently see Finland facing a military threat from Russia. The Finnish President's remarks come after Russian President Vladimir Putin's move to recognise two breakaway Ukrainian regions as independent.

136.title: Ahan wins Best Debut at Dadasaheb Phalke Int'l Film Festival Awards
136.article_body: Actor Ahan Shetty won Best Debut at the Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival Awards 2022 for his performance in 'Tadap'. Taking to Instagram, Ahan wrote, "Thank you to everyone for the love and support." Actor Ranveer Singh won the Best Actor for '83' and Kriti Sanon won Best Actress for 'Mimi'.

137.title: SP showered love on terrorists who are guilty of blasts in UP: PM
137.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the Samajwadi Party (SP) "showered love on terrorists who are guilty of many blasts in Uttar Pradesh". He also said the "Parivarvaadis...were conspiring to release those terrorists from jail". "It is sad when the Parivarvaadi governments sacrifice the interest of the people for their selfish motives," PM Modi added.

138.title: UP was a terror hotspot & mafia corridor under SP-BSP: Amit Shah
138.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya on Tuesday held a roadshow in Prayagraj. Addressing an election rally, Shah said, "UP was a terror hotspot...and a mafia corridor under SP-BSP...Today, BJP is building a defence corridor, replacing mafia corridor." Prayagraj will go for voting in the fifth phase of UP elections on February 27.

139.title: Queen Elizabeth cancels virtual meeting due to COVID-19 symptoms
139.article_body: Buckingham Palace on Tuesday said Queen Elizabeth II will skip a planned virtual meeting as she continues to experience mild cold-like symptoms after having tested positive for COVID-19 on Sunday. The palace added she will decide closer to the time whether to continue with any future engagements, including her weekly conversation with Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Wednesday.

140.title: Software startup Hasura turns unicorn with $100 million fundraise
140.article_body: Software startup Hasura announced on Tuesday it has become a unicorn after raising $100 million in funding led by Greenoaks at a valuation of $1 billion. The Series C round of financing saw participation from Nexus Venture Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Vertex Ventures and Strive. Hasura, which has offices in San Francisco and Bengaluru, has raised $136.5 million to date.

141.title: Melania Trump told PM Modi she'd only visit Kejriwal's schools: Delhi CM
141.article_body: Speaking about former US President Donald Trump and former First Lady Melania Trump's visit to India in 2020, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "The President's wife told PM Narendra Modi that she would only visit Kejriwal's schools." "She never made such a demand in any nation," Kejriwal added. Delhi CM was addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh.

142.title: Putin sits at distance with security council in meeting over Ukraine; pics viral
142.article_body: During a meeting over the recognition of two breakaway regions in Ukraine as independent, Russian President Vladimir Putin sat at a long distance with his security council. The meeting which was televised, showed Putin seated alone while the military and security chiefs took turns addressing him from a podium. Soon after, the pictures of the meeting were widely shared online.

143.title: When I met Bobby, ‘Duniya Haseenon Ka Mela’ played in my head: Sanya
143.article_body: Actress Sanya Malhotra said she couldn't concentrate when she first met actor Bobby Deol. "Jab main pehli baar mili, mere dimaag mein sirf 'Duniya Haseenon Ka Mela' chal raha tha (When I first met him, 'Duniya Haseenon Ka Mela' was playing in my head)...I met him as a fangirl," she stated. Sanya and Bobby will be seen in 'Love Hostel'.

144.title: Pak PM's step-son arrested for liquor possession, released after 'orders from top'
144.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's step-son Musa Maneka was arrested briefly with two others and was booked on charges of liquor possession after alcohol was found in their car, police said. Maneka is Pakistan's First Lady Bushra Bibi's son from her previous marriage. He was "released the same day after orders from the top", a police official said.

145.title: Monthly stipend of ₹900 per cow if BJP wins in UP polls: Adityanath
145.article_body:
Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath while addressing a poll rally on Tuesday asked people to vote for those who protect cows and not those who kill them. He also announced 
a monthly stipend of ₹900 per cow for farmers who rear them. He added that his government will not compromise with the security of cows under any circumstances.

146.title: DMK's transwoman candidate wins Tamil Nadu urban local body polls
146.article_body: Ganga Nayak, a transwoman who was fielded by DMK in Tamil Nadu's urban local body polls, won from ward 37 of Vellore Municipal Corporation. Ganga, 49, was born to daily wage workers in Vellore. She has gained recognition for her drama troupe, which employs 50 members, including 30 transgender persons. She has been a DMK member for 20 years.

147.title: This is an election to save democracy, change fate of UP: Akhilesh
147.article_body: Addressing an election rally in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, Samajwadi Party chief on Tuesday said that the ongoing Assembly elections in UP are not ordinary. He said, "This is not an ordinary Assembly election but polls to save the democracy and change the fate of UP." He further claimed that ever since the BJP government came, inflation and unemployment have increased.

148.title: They've got best spin attack in the world: Tamim on Afghan spinners
148.article_body: Bangladesh captain Tamim Iqbal Khan has called Afghanistan spin attack the "best in the world", saying he doesn't want to talk much about any particular Afghan bowler. The Afghan spin attack features Rashid Khan, Mujeeb Ur Rahman and Mohammad Nabi. Bangladesh-Afghanistan will play three ODIs and two T20Is. First ODI will be played on Wednesday in Chattogram.

149.title: Take a deep breath, reveal the name: Sehwag as Saha says he won't expose journalist
149.article_body: After Wriddhiman Saha said he won't expose the journalist who threatened him, Virender Sehwag tweeted, "Dear Wriddhi, it's not your nature to harm others and you are a wonderful guy." He added, "But to prevent such harm from happening to anyone else in the future, it's important for you to name him. Take a deep breath and reveal the name."

150.title: May not act immediately: Switzerland on sanctions against Russia
150.article_body: Switzerland is liaising with nations on sanctions against Russia but may not act immediately, its government said on Tuesday amid escalating Ukraine-Russia tensions. Switzerland's remark comes as sanctions by US and UK were imposed against Ukrainian breakaway regions of Donetsk and Luhansk and five Russian banks respectively. They were imposed after Russia recognised the regions as independent.

151.title: Germany suspends gas project with Russia over Ukrainian crisis
151.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Tuesday said that he has taken steps to halt the process of certifying the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline from Russia. The decision is in response to Russian President Vladimir Putin's recognition of the independence of two breakaway regions in Ukraine. The pipeline is set to double natural gas supplies from Russia to Germany.

152.title: Peter Dinklage seemingly teases appearance as Eitri in 'Thor 4'
152.article_body: Actor Peter Dinklage seemingly teased his return as Eitri in the upcoming film 'Thor: Love and Thunder'. In an interview, he said, "There's another Thor movie...isn't there? Coming out that (Taika) Waititi directed. But I didn't say anything." Peter further said if you die in a Marvel movie, it won't matter because it doesn't mean it's your last Marvel movie.

153.title: Maybe ask next time?: UK firm to Trump's Truth Social over identical logo
153.article_body: UK-based solar power company Trailar is considering legal action against former US President Donald Trump's new social media app Truth Social over the similarity of their logos. Sharing a user's side-by-side comparison of Trailar and Truth Social's logo, the company tagged members of Trump family and tweeted, "Great to see...Trump supporting a growing sustainability business! Maybe ask next time?"

154.title: 4 arrested in UP's Azamgarh liquor tragedy, death toll rises to 5
154.article_body: The death toll from liquor consumption in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh rose to five, while 46 people are undergoing treatment, officials said. The incident reportedly occurred on Sunday when villagers fainted after consuming country-made liquor. Meanwhile, SP Anurag Arya said that four persons have been arrested in relation to the case, adding that a detailed investigation is ongoing in the matter.

155.title: 63 killed in blast at gold mining site in Burkina Faso: Report
155.article_body: A blast at a gold mining site in Burkina Faso on Monday killed 63 people and injured 40 others, a judicial source told Reuters. The explosion was believed to have been caused by chemicals used to treat gold that were stocked at the site, a report said. An investigation has been opened into the explosion, the source said.

156.title: Pic surfaces showing Shibani applying mehendi to Farhan's hand
156.article_body: Fashion designer Payal Singhal on Monday took to Instagram Stories to share a picture from the mehendi ceremony of Farhan Akhtar and Shibani Dandekar. The picture shows Shibani applying mehendi to Farhan's hand. Payal wrote along with the picture, "Thank you for finding each other, you are adorable together. Two peas in a pod." The couple got married on Saturday.

157.title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic to be offered new contract by AC Milan: Reports
157.article_body: AC Milan will reportedly offer 40-year-old striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic a new contract, with the Swede's current contract set to expire in June this year. Ibrahimovic has scored eight goals in 15 appearances for AC Milan so far this season. Ibrahimovic re-joined AC Milan on a free-transfer in December 2019 after spending two years with MLS club LA Galaxy.

158.title: Biggest Pterosaur fossil from 170 mn years ago discovered in Scotland
158.article_body: Researchers discovered a well-preserved 170 million-year-old fossil in Scotland that belonged to the biggest Pterosaur from the Jurassic Period. Named Dearc sgiathanach (pronounced as jark ski-an-ach), this flying reptile had a wingspan of 2.5 metres and was about the same size as a modern albatross, lead author Natalia Jagielska said. She added the animal had sharp upper and lower teeth.

159.title: KL Rahul donates ₹31 lakh for 11-year-old cricketer's bone marrow transplant
159.article_body: Cricketer KL Rahul has donated ₹31 lakh for an 11-year-old aspiring cricketer Varad's bone marrow transplant to treat a rare blood disorder. "I hope Varad gets back on his feet at the earliest and goes on to achieve his dreams. I hope my contribution inspires more and more people to come forward and help those in need," Rahul said.

160.title: May break diplomatic ties with Russia: Ukraine as troops sent to rebel regions
160.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky has said that he will consider the issue of severing diplomatic relations with Russia after the latter sent troops to its separatist regions. He said he has received a request from the foreign ministry for the same. He also urged Ukraine's allies to not wait for further escalation, to impose sanctions.

161.title: Not surprised: AICF Secretary on Praggnanandhaa beating world no. 1 Carlsen
161.article_body: Following 16-year-old R Praggnanandhaa's win over world number one Magnus Carlsen in eighth round of ongoing Airthings Masters, All India Chess Federation (AICF) Secretary Bharat Singh Chauhan said he's not surprised by the Indian Grandmaster's performance. "He is very well-versed with the theory and very dynamic. Good at tactics also, so I think it was a wonderful game," Chauhan added.

162.title: HC summons Chandigarh chief engineer over power crisis due to strike
162.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court on Tuesday took suo motu cognisance of power crisis in Chandigarh due to a strike. It summoned Chandigarh chief engineer to list the steps being taken to tackle the crisis. "The court cannot be oblivious to the fact that destruction of electricity supply...may affect...hospitals where patients may be on ventilator," it said.

163.title: Alarmed at reports of migrants being pushed back by Greece: UN
163.article_body: The UN on Monday called reports of migrants being pushed back from entering Greece "horrific incidents". "We're alarmed by...reports coming from Greece's...borders with Turkey, where UNHCR has recorded almost 540...incidents of informal returns by Greece since...2020," a UN official said. The UN's remarks come after 19 migrants froze to death near Turkey's border with Greece earlier this month.

164.title: Case against Sonu Sood for allegedly campaigning for sister on poll day in Punjab
164.article_body: The Moga police have registered a case against actor Sonu Sood for allegedly violating model code of conduct and campaigning for his sister on the day of voting. Sood's sister, Malvika, was contesting in the Punjab Assembly elections on a Congress ticket. On Sunday, the Election Commission had stopped him from visiting the polling booths in Moga.

165.title: Manipur will be an important centre for East Asia connectivity: PM
165.article_body: While addressing a rally in Manipur's Heingang, PM Narendra Modi said, "Manipur will become an important centre for East Asia connectivity after the highway connecting Myanmar-Thailand is completed." PM Modi said that rail connectivity in the region will enhance tourism and provide employment opportunities for the youth. Manipur is the gateway to India's trade with East Asia, he added.

166.title: US meat firms spray 1 lakh ton pesticides every year in farms: Report
166.article_body: World Animal Protection (WAP) and Center for Biological Diversity (CBD) report revealed US meat and dairy industries used 1.17 lakh tons of herbicides and insecticides across corn and soy farms every year, posing fatal risk to thousands of species. As per report, the pesticides contained harmful chemicals such as glyphosate, atrazine that can kill endangered plant and animal species.

167.title: Why didn't UP govt move SC over bail to Lakhimpur accused: Jayant
167.article_body: RLD chief Jayant Chaudhary on Tuesday asked why UP government did not file a review petition in the Supreme Court against the bail granted to Ashish Mishra, an accused in Lakhimpur Kheri incident. "Yogi ji should tell why was he so happy with Ashish Mishra Teni getting bail?" Jayant asked. "The point is clear: BJP government is anti-farmer," he said.

168.title: There's a buzz for LIC IPO in market, going ahead with it: Sitharaman
168.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said the government is going ahead with the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) IPO amid concerns raised over rising Russia-Ukraine tensions. "There is a buzz in the market and there is interest for LIC IPO," she said. The way the IPO prospectus has been crafted has generated a lot of interest, Sitharaman added.

169.title: Indian travellers to Dubai don't need to undergo pre-departure COVID-19 test
169.article_body: Indian travellers to Dubai will not need to undergo COVID-19 RT-PCR tests at Indian airports before boarding flights as Dubai removed the mandate, effective from today (February 22). Till now, passengers were supposed to take the test at the departure airports within six hours of their flight. The mandate has also been removed for Pakistan, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka.

170.title: Kashmiri man weaves carpet with Salman's pic, says 'want to gift it to him'
170.article_body: A carpet weaver from Srinagar has made a silk carpet with Bollywood actor Salman Khan's photo from his savings to present it as a gift to him. The artisan took six months to make the wall-hanging carpet. "Since there wasn't much work during the lockdown, I thought of paying my tributes to [Salman]," he said.

171.title: I did no special preparation: 16-yr-old Praggnanandhaa on beating Magnus
171.article_body: India's 16-year-old chess Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa, who defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in the eighth round of the Airthings Masters, had "no special plan or preparation" for the match. Praggnanandhaa added, "I just wanted to enjoy playing against him and not put too much pressure on myself." Praggnanandhaa's victory with black pieces came when Carlsen resigned after 39 moves.

172.title: Young entrepreneur shares pic with Ratan Tata, says 'Blessed to have him as mentor'
172.article_body: Arjun Deshpande, a young entrepreneur whose pharma startup Generic Aadhaar received investment from Ratan Tata, recently took to social media to share a picture with the Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons. "In every meet, there are new learnings and motivation for me and I am truly blessed to have Ratan Tata Sir as my Mentor," Deshpande captioned the picture.

173.title: Are you okay?: US Starbucks staff leaves message for girl approached by stranger
173.article_body: A Starbucks employee wrote a message on a cup for an 18-year-old US girl who was approached by an unknown man at the cafe. It read, "Are you okay? Do you want us to intervene? If you do, take the lid off the cup." However, the girl didn't need any intervention and she let the staff know she was okay.

174.title: Brown sugar worth ₹1.22 crore seized in Odisha, 1 arrested
174.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of the Odisha Police seized 1.227 kg of brown sugar worth ₹1.22 crore and arrested a wanted drug peddler, the police said on Tuesday.
