The volcanic eruption that took place on January 15, triggered a tsunami that reached as far as Alaska, Japan, and South America. Around 85% of Tonga's population was affected by the disaster.

348.title: Lived with mental illness, was conscious of portrayal: Deepika on 'Gehraiyaan'
348.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said that having lived with mental illness, she was conscious about how it was portrayed in 'Gehraiyaan'. "But it's not like the film is about that. It's one of the threads. In fact, it's not even a thread, it's backstory, or something that this character is dealing with. But there's so much else going on," she added.

349.title: Our work in last 5 yrs laid foundation for next 25 yrs: PM in Manipur
349.article_body: In the last five years, BJP's double engine government worked towards the overall development of Manipur, PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday while addressing a rally in the state. "You have seen BJP's good governance and good intentions. Our work in the last five years has laid the foundation for the next 25 years," PM Modi added.

350.title: Chandigarh faces power outage in many parts as electricity dept staff go on strike
350.article_body: A major power outage was reported in parts of Chandigarh as employees of the electricity department went on a three-day strike against privatisation. The employees have reportedly threatened to extend the protest indefinitely if the move isn't halted. The administration told the Municipal Corporation to arrange alternative sources of power supply and seek Haryana and Punjab's aid for manpower.

351.title: Maharashtra govt culls over 25,000 birds amid bird flu scare
351.article_body: Days after bird flu cases were detected in Maharashtra's Thane and Palghar districts, the state decided to kill over 25,000 birds. "The decision of killing over 25,000 birds in 1 km radius of infection hotspots in both districts was taken. The labourers working in farms have also been isolated," said state's Animal Husbandry Minister Sunil Kedar.

352.title: Eve-teasers stabbed to death by woman's brothers in Karnataka
352.article_body: Two people, Salem and Abdulla, were stabbed to death in Karnataka's Shivamogga by a girl's brothers, Dadapeer and Tippu, for allegedly misbehaving with her. Police said that Salem and Abdulla had come on a bike and allegedly misbehaved with their sister. An officer said that Dadapeer called his friend Allabhaksh and others to thrash them, which resulted in the murder.

353.title: All accused in Bajrang Dal activist murder case identified: Karnataka ADGP
353.article_body: All the accused in Bajrang Dal activist murder case have been identified, Karnataka's Additional Director General of Police Pratap Reddy said. "Work is going on and we are on the verge of completing the detection and arresting the accused persons," Reddy added. This comes after a 26-year-old Bajrang Dal activist named Harsha was allegedly murdered in Karnataka's Shivamogga on Sunday.

354.title: I did prepare you: Karan to Shakun on polarising reactions for Gehraiyaan
354.article_body: Producer Karan Johar said that he tried to prepare director Shakun Batra for the polarising response that he was sure that Gehraiyaan would attract. "Karan and I...knew there were going to be opinions," Shakun added. "[Karan] did say, this can be polarised...He's somebody who's seen films release over decades, he has...more sense of how the audience can react," Shakun said.

355.title: Before whiskey started showing up on belly: Anurag shares pic from college days
355.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap took to Instagram and shared a throwback picture from his college days. "Before the whiskey started showing up on the belly...circa 1991," he wrote with the hashtags 'Hansraj College' and 'hostel life'. Anil Kapoor, who worked with the filmmaker in 'AK vs AK', reacted to his post, writing, "Is this really you Mr Anurag Kashyap?"

356.title: Fleet management startup Fleetx raises ₹145 cr led by IndiaMart
356.article_body: Gurugram-based fleet management platform Fleetx.io has raised over ₹145 crore in IndiaMart-led funding. Others who participated in the round include India Quotient and BEENEXT. Founded by Vineet Sharma, Abhay Jeet Gupta, Udbhav Rai, Parveen Kataria and Vishal Misra, Fleetx provides IoT and software-based products to help fleet operators and industries digitise logistics operations.

357.title: 2 women held with 129 gm suspected brown sugar in Nagaland: Police
357.article_body: Nagaland police arrested two women drug smugglers after recovering suspected brown sugar from them on Monday. Giving details about the incident, Dimapur Police tweeted, "Alert GRPS personnel of Dimapur police during routine checking at the railway station noticed two women moving in a suspicious manner. Upon frisking, the police recovered 129 grams of suspected brown sugar."

358.title: Richa Ghosh smashes the fastest-ever fifty by an Indian woman in ODI cricket off 26 balls
358.article_body: India Women wicketkeeper Richa Ghosh today recorded the fastest-ever fifty by an Indian woman in ODI cricket off 26 balls. The 18-year-old scored a total of 52 runs off 29 deliveries against New Zealand Women in the fourth ODI, which was reduced to 20 overs per side due to rain. The previous record was held by Rumeli Dhar (29 balls).

359.title: Indian Cricketers' Association condemns threat by journalist to Saha, issues statement
359.article_body: The Indian Cricketers' Association (ICA) has condemned the threat issued by a journalist to wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha. In a statement, the association urged BCCI to take "strictest possible action in the matter". "Should BCCI feel the need to cancel the erring journalist's accreditation and access to any BCCI event, we'll fully support the move," the association's President Ashok Malhotra said.

360.title: Father, daughter electrocuted after live wire falls on them in MP
360.article_body: A 40-year-old man and his six-year-old daughter died of electrocution after a live wire from an electric pole fell on them in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat on Monday. The wire broke off the pole following a spark when they were sitting in their home's courtyard, police said. According to electricity department, the fault occurred due to movement of squirrels on pole.

361.title: Govt blocks apps, website of 'Punjab Politics TV' linked to banned group
361.article_body: The government has ordered blocking of apps, websites and social media accounts of foreign-based 'Punjab Politics TV'. It said the channel has close links with Sikhs For Justice (SFJ), which has been declared unlawful under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967. "The channel was attempting to use online media to disturb public order during...ongoing State Assembly elections," it added.

362.title: What an achievement: Ashwin on Praggnanandhaa beating Carlsen
362.article_body: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin took to Twitter to congratulate 16-year-old Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa after he defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in Airthings Masters, an online rapid chess tournament. "What an achievement from Praggnanandhaa to beat Carlsen. An achievement the entire country is proud of," tweeted Ashwin. Praggnanandhaa is third Indian to beat Carlsen.

363.title: Hijab row also being looked at in Bajrang Dal activist's murder case: K'taka minister
363.article_body: Over 12 people have been taken into custody by police in connection with the murder of 26-year-old Bajrang Dal activist Harsha in Karnataka's Shivamogga district, state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said on Tuesday. Jnanendra further said the role of organisations behind the hijab row is also being looked at. "We are taking this case to the logical end," he added.

364.title: Ajay sets reminder for his, Kajol's anniversary, says 'won't forget this time'
364.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Instagram Stories to share picture of set reminder for his and actress Kajol's wedding anniversary. The reminder has been set for Thursday, February 24. "Iss baar nahi bhoolunga [Won't forget this time]," Ajay wrote. He shared reminder with picture from couple's visit to 'Koffee with Karan' where he had forgotten wedding anniversary date during game.

365.title: 11 arrested for attacking journalists during Odisha panchayat polls
365.article_body: At least 11 persons have been arrested in connection with an attack on journalists during third phase of panchayat polls in Odisha. Three journalists were beaten up by a mob consisting of about 40 people on Sunday while reporting allegations of poll rigging in the Binjharpur area of Jajpur. The trio was rescued and taken to hospital by police.

366.title: Ready to join US-led sanctions on Russia over Ukraine: Japan
366.article_body: Japan said it stood ready to join the US and other G7 nations in imposing sanctions on Russia, if President Vladimir Putin orders an invasion of Ukraine. The announcement comes after Putin ordered troops into two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine after recognising them as "independent". Putin's decision to recognise the separatist regions is "unacceptable", Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said.

367.title: Today's date is both a palindrome and an ambigram
367.article_body: The date today 22/02/2022 is both a palindrome and an ambigram, as it can be read the same way forward, backward, and upside down. The palindrome and ambigram work for the British date format (dd-mm-yyyy) but not for the US date format (mm-dd-yyyy). The last double (both a palindrome and an ambigram) fell on 12/02/2021.

368.title: Guests at wedding reception get into street fight in Australia; video goes viral
368.article_body: Guests at a wedding reception were seen fighting on a street in Australia, with the video of the brawl going viral online. In the video, a man can be seen charging at a woman as others try to intervene, while, another man can be seen lying unconscious on the road. The incident occurred at The Spit in Mosman.

369.title: Vehicle thief held in Hyd; 2 tractors, tanker worth ₹12 lakh seized
369.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police said on Monday that a 47-year-old vehicle thief has been arrested and two tractors and a tanker worth ₹12 lakh have been seized from his possession. According to the police, the accused is a habitual offender and a notorious property offender. The accused was arrested based on credible information received by police in Meerpet.

370.title: People want controversy but I am much more than that: Nisha on Lock Upp
370.article_body: Actress Nisha Rawal, who was announced as the first contestant of 'Lock Upp' on Monday, said people just keep talking about that "one episode" in her life with her estranged husband, Karan Mehra. "I know it's a bold show and people want controversy but I'm much more than just that," she added. Nisha said that "one incident" doesn't define her.

371.title: Twitter suspends fake accounts in China promoting Beijing Olympics
371.article_body: Twitter has suspended hundreds of fake Chinese accounts that were included in a recent investigation into Chinese Olympic propaganda. The probe found 3,000 fake accounts coordinating to promote the Beijing Olympics, many of which glossed over controversies involving human rights abuses in China. Twitter said the accounts were suspended for violating the "platform manipulation and spam policy".

372.title: 3 booked for attempting to murder BJP workers in Punjab amid polls
372.article_body: Three people have been booked for allegedly attempting to murder BJP workers in Punjab's Ludhiana during state Assembly elections. BJP Ludhiana Central candidate Gurdev Sharma Debi claimed that the accused attacked the party workers after they asked for identification on suspicion that the accused were bogus voters. The accused had come out of the polling booth when the incident occurred.

373.title: 6 workers killed, 12 injured in blast at fireworks factory in Himachal Pradesh's Una
373.article_body: At least six workers were killed in a blast at a fireworks factory in the Bathu industrial area of Himachal Pradesh's Una on Tuesday. Around 12 workers suffered burn injuries and were brought to a nearby hospital in Una. Fire department personnel and district officials are present at the spot for relief and rescue operations, ANI reported.

374.title: PM should keep 'Ghaziabad poet' to identify terrorists: Kejriwal on Vishwas
374.article_body: In a veiled attack at former AAP leader Kumar Vishwas, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that PM Narendra Modi should remove all Central agencies and keep the 'Ghaziabad poet' on the job to identify terrorists. This comes after Vishwas said, "One day, Kejriwal told me he would either become CM of Punjab or first PM of Khalistan."

375.title: COVID-19 found on imported pork, beef packaging in Hong Kong
375.article_body: Hong Kong authorities said they've found coronavirus in samples taken from the packaging of imports of frozen pork skin from Poland and frozen beef from Brazil. The Centre for Food Safety (CFS) has ordered the importers to dispose of the beef and pork skin from the concerned batches. The CFS will step up inspections of imported food, the government said.

376.title: Will help in safe disposal: Official on Ghaziabad's 1st dog crematorium
376.article_body: The Ghaziabad municipal corporation is likely to commence operations for city's first crematorium for dogs this week. "Till now, people made their own arrangements for the cremation or burial of pets. Even community dogs were buried in open spaces. This facility will help the city with the safe and scientific disposal of dead dogs," Rajendra Tyagi, Raj Nagar councillor, said.

377.title: Public welfare govt can never promote capitalism: Varun Gandhi
377.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi said a "public welfare government" can never promote capitalism as it creates economic inequality. "Just the privatisation of banks and railways will leave five lakh people jobless. With every job that's lost, the hope for lakhs of families diminishes. A public welfare government can never promote capitalism by creating economic inequality at social level," Varun tweeted.

378.title: Really hurt, PCB must take action: Hafeez on Faulkner's allegations
378.article_body: Reacting to James Faulkner's allegations over non-payment of dues by Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB), Mohammad Hafeez said they really "hurt" him as a Pakistani, adding that the PCB must take action. "I was not expecting this from Faulkner. The allegations were wrong," added Hafeez. The PCB had earlier said that Faulkner damaged hotel property in Lahore.

379.title: Dumped by NRI woman, ex-lover leaks her intimate pics in Ahmedabad
379.article_body: A 23-year-old man from Ahmedabad was arrested for allegedly leaking intimate pictures with his ex-girlfriend on social media. The accused had filmed his intimate moments with the woman over the last one year of their relationship. But she broke up with him when she moved to Australia for higher studies. Enraged with this, he leaked her intimate photos online.

380.title: Case under Atrocities Act registered against IIMC Amravati head
380.article_body: A case has been registered against Indian Institute of Mass Communication (IIMC) Amravati's Director, Anil Kumar Saumitra under Atrocities Act, police said. An assistant professor from the college alleged in his complaint that Saumitra would mentally torture and humiliate him in front of students and staff. He also stopped his lectures because he belonged to the Scheduled Caste, he added.

381.title: K'taka hijab case petitioner's brother attacked, father's restaurant vandalised: Police
381.article_body: One of the girls from Udupi, who have approached the Karnataka High Court in the hijab case, has alleged that some miscreants attacked her brother and vandalised her father's restaurant in Malpe. "I demand action be taken against the Sangh Parivar goons," she tweeted. Udupi SP said a windowpane was damaged and one of the miscreants slapped the girl's brother.

382.title: Would've been a nightmare to handle 3 big stars in 'Kai Po Che': Director
382.article_body: As 'Kai Po Che' completed nine years on Tuesday, director Abhishek Kapoor spoke about his decision to cast Sushant Singh Rajput, Amit Sadh and Rajkummar Rao in the film. "We did try to have big names initially...But it wasn't written...that way," he said, adding, "It was about friendship, where they were equals. It would've been...nightmare to handle three big stars."

383.title: SC seeks govt's response on PIL seeking enforcement of citizens' fundamental duties
383.article_body: The Supreme Court sought response from the Centre and states on a plea seeking direction for enacting well-defined laws or rules to ensure adherence of the fundamental duties as enshrined in the Constitution. The court sought directions to the Centre and states for framing of guidelines for taking appropriate steps to sensitise people regarding the fundamental duties under the Constitution.

384.title: Reporter covers Russia-Ukraine crisis in six languages; video goes viral
384.article_body: A video of a journalist's six-language coverage of the tensions between Russia and Ukraine has gone viral on social media. The video compilation shared by Associated Press Global Media Services' Philip Crowther showed him reporting for various news organisations in English, Luxembourgish, Spanish, Portuguese, French and German. He's currently in Ukraine's capital Kiev, reporting on the crisis.

385.title: Netherlands fines Apple $5.7 mn, its 5th such penalty in weeks
385.article_body: The Netherlands has fined Apple $5.7 million, the fifth such penalty in successive weeks in a row, over access to non-Apple payment methods for subscriptions to dating apps. The ACM said Apple is abusing its position by not allowing developers to use other methods. It has been levying weekly fines of $5.7 million since Apple missed a January 15 deadline.

386.title: Shameful that Bajrang Dal activist killed in BJP-ruled state: BJP MP
386.article_body: After Bajrang Dal activist Harsha's killing in Karnataka, BJP MP from Mysuru-Kodagu, Pratap Simha said it was very painful to see Harsha's body but at the same time, it was shameful that even after the BJP government came to power, the same situation continues. "When all our workers were murdered, we used to blame KFD...Now it's our government," Simha stated.

387.title: 2 of late Indian painter Raja Ravi Varma's paintings sell as NFTs for over ₹1 crore
387.article_body: Late Indian painter Raja Ravi Varma's two paintings, 'The Coquette' and 'Reclining Nair Lady', have been sold for $74,999 (about ₹56 lakh) and $63,999 (about ₹47 lakh) as NFTs in an auction held from February 17 to 20. The auction was conducted by RtistiQ, a physical and digital art marketplace. It is not known who has bought the two NFTs.

388.title: We are ready to defend ourselves: Ukraine amid Russia invasion threat
388.article_body: Amid Russian invasion threat, Ukraine Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov said, "We remain confident and calm. We are ready and able to defend ourselves and our sovereignty." His statement comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin recognised two breakaway regions in Ukraine as independent. Putin also ordered the deployment of soldiers, whom he called "peacemakers", to the regions.

389.title: South Korean drama 'Something in the Rain' to get Indian remake
389.article_body: 'Something in the Rain', a South Korean drama series starring Jung Hae In and Son Ye Jin, is set for an Indian adaptation. "We've recently confirmed...production of Indian remake of 'Something In the Rain' with Pocket Aces," JTBC Studio, the production house behind the original show, said in a statement. Pocket Aces is known for its four-season series 'Little Things'.

390.title: Question is how much cricket will he play: Karthik on Rohit being all-format captain
390.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said while Rohit Sharma, who has now been named India captain across formats, is a quality captain, the question is how much cricket is the 34-year-old going to play. "I think Rohit is very astute tactically...He is a quality captain...there's no doubt about that," Karthik added. Rohit will lead India in two-Test series against Sri Lanka.

391.title: Man who asked 3 people to not talk loudly during movie in Maha attacked
391.article_body: A 24-year-old man, Saurabh Bhoir, was attacked by three people with soda bottles outside a movie theatre in Maharashtra after he and his friends told them to not talk loudly during movie. "During interval...nine to ten people...started assaulting us...Theatre management stopped them...called police...When we left and were near the gate, they started throwing soda bottles on us," Bhoir said.

392.title: 2-yr-old dies as father kicks her to ground during fight with wife in UP
392.article_body: A 2-year-old girl died after her father allegedly kicked her to ground during fight with his wife in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad. Officials said family members were making arrangements to "hurriedly bury" her body. Police reached the spot and body was sent for post-mortem. The girl's grandfather said she suffered critical injuries. Meanwhile, police said she was declared dead at hospital.

393.title: Salman saw potential in me even when I didn't know I had: Deepika
393.article_body: Discussing her relationship with Salman Khan, Deepika Padukone said they have always had a "beautiful" relationship, adding, "He saw potential in me even when I didn't know I had." "I will always be grateful to Salman because he was one of the first to offer me a film," stated Deepika. Deepika, Salman are yet to star together in a film.

394.title: Playing my character in 'Love Hostel' tormented me: Vikrant Massey
394.article_body: Terming his character in the upcoming film 'Love Hostel' as one whose portrayal left him "awake" for most nights, actor Vikrant Massey said playing his character in the film "really tormented" his mind. "It was a turbulent time...as I was going through a lot," added Vikrant. Vikrant and Sanya Malhotra play a newly married couple on the run.

395.title: Pune BJP corporator quits party, alleges leaders didn't allow her to work
395.article_body: A BJP corporator Chanda Lokhande from Pimple Gurav within the Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation limits has quit the party. BJP corporators and leaders did not allow her to work, Lokhande alleged. Notably, the term of the current civic body ends on March 13. The Maharashtra government has been left with no choice but to appoint an administrator, civic officials said.

396.title: No better multi-skilled cricketer than Ravindra Jadeja: Sanjay Bangar
396.article_body: Sanjay Bangar said there is no better "multi-skilled" cricketer than Ravindra Jadeja, adding that it will be a toss-up between Jadeja and Shardul Thakur for the all-rounder's role in India's T20I setup. "Jadeja's batting has been on the rise...and him being a left-hander can add that right-left sort of combination in the lower order as well," stated Bangar.

397.title: SC to hear plea seeking cancellation of offline Class 10 & 12 board exams tomorrow
397.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has agreed to hear a plea seeking the cancellation of physical exams for classes 10 and 12 to be conducted by all state boards, CBSE, ICSE and National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS). The plea will be heard by a bench led by Justice AM Khanwilkar on Wednesday, Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana said.

398.title: What Dravid did, that's the way it should be done: Aakash on Wriddhiman Saha
398.article_body: Talking about the controversy over Wriddhiman Saha, commentator Aakash Chopra said head coach Rahul Dravid did the "correct thing" informing Saha about getting dropped. "The truth is that Dravid was absolutely honest...when someone has played for India, you keep your hand on his shoulders and tell him the truth that the selectors...are looking in a different direction," Aakash added.

399.title: Largest ever solar eruption captured by Solar Orbiter spacecraft
399.article_body: The largest solar prominence eruption ever observed was captured in a single image together with the complete solar disk by NASA and European Space Agency (ESA) joint project, Solar Orbiter spacecraft. The Full Sun Imager (FSI) of the Extreme Ultraviolet Imager (EUI) on orbiter captured the image. The eruption apparently originated from the side of sun, facing away from earth.

400.title: Plea for hijab will bind every Muslim woman: K'taka govt tells HC
400.article_body: The Karnataka government told the High Court on Monday that the petitioners are seeking to declare the hijab as an 'essential religious practice' which will bind every Muslim woman to follow a particular dress code. The petitioners have not placed any material on record to prove that wearing hijab is an essential religious practice, Advocate General (AG) Prabhuling Navadgi added.

401.title: Calculated act: NZ on Russia recognising Ukraine separatist regions
401.article_body: New Zealand's Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta said there was "no basis under international law" for recognising the rebel-held regions and by doing so Russia is further undermining the sovereignty, territorial integrity of Ukraine. "We're concerned that this is a calculated act by Russian President Vladimir Putin to create a pretext for invasion, which would be...clear act of aggression," she said.

402.title: SRK's son Aryan to make his debut as writer, working on web series and film: Reports
402.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan will make his debut as a writer and is working on scripts for web series and a feature film, as per reports. "Of all [his] ideas in development...the two in forefront are web series for Amazon Prime and a feature film to be bankrolled by Red Chillies Entertainment," Pinkvilla reported quoting a source as saying.

403.title: Donald Trump's Truth Social app faces 13-hour partial outage shortly after launch
403.article_body: Donald Trump's new social media app Truth Social encountered technical difficulties shortly after it was made available to the public. According to its status page, the outage lasted for 13 hours and 14 minutes on February 21 and was related to "application launch traffic". Several users complained that they were either having trouble registering or were added to a waitlist.

404.title: Police cannot force eateries running late at night to close down: Madras HC
404.article_body: Police cannot force eateries running late at night to close down, Madras HC has ruled. HC allowed a writ petition seeking to dismiss an order of the Kilpauk Police interfering with the petitioner running an eatery late at night. The right of the businessmen to run their hotel or restaurant is guaranteed under Article 19(1)(g) of the Constitution, HC added.

405.title: Govt releases list of additional flights from Ukraine to India amid Russia threat
405.article_body: The government has released a list of additional flights from Ukraine to India amid Russian invasion threat. "At present, Air Arabia, Fly Dubai, Qatar Airways etc are also operating their routine flights from Ukraine to India. Bookings of these flights can be done through respective airlines offices, websites, call centres and authorised travel agents," the government said.

406.title: Russia preparing 'kill list' before invading Ukraine: US
406.article_body: The US has written to the top United Nations human rights official that it has "credible information" that Russia is preparing a "kill list" before invading Ukraine. Bathsheba Nell Crocker, the US Representative to the Office of the United Nations and Other International Organizations in Geneva, said that Russian forces are identifying Ukrainians "to be killed or sent to camps".

407.title: Indian investors lose ₹9.1 lakh crore amid Russia-Ukraine crisis since Feb 16
407.article_body: The geopolitical tensions between Ukraine and Russia have eroded the market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies by ₹9.1 lakh crore since February 16, Moneycontrol reported. On Tuesday, the Indian benchmark indices crashed by around 2% after Russia recognised two breakaway regions in Ukraine as independent and ordered troop deployment there. The Sensex opened 1,245 points lower at 56,439.

408.title: He saw it with me first: Arjun teases Alia as Ranbir visits Taj Mahal with him
408.article_body: Arjun Kapoor on Monday shared a picture of himself, which was apparently clicked by Ranbir Kapoor. Sharing the post, Arjun wrote, "When Ranbir Kapoor the artist emerged, inspired by the Taj + Me." Reacting to the post, Rakul Preet Singh wrote, "Finally you both saw the Taj." Arjun replied, "He saw it with me first instead of going with Alia."

409.title: No-sleep club: Amitabh responds to fan who says he looks tired in new pic
409.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan responded to a fan on Twitter who pointed out that he looks tired in his pictures. Sharing a picture that Amitabh posted on Sunday's blog, a fan tweeted, "Looking so tired." Amitabh then pointed out to the line written on his jacket and tweeted, "[I'm in] the 'no sleep club'...you have not [read] the patch on the jacket?"

410.title: Massive volcanic ash from Italy's Mount Etna blankets nearby towns
410.article_body: A massive 10 km high pillar of volcanic ash erupted from Italy's Mount Etna on Monday blanketing the nearby towns. No injuries or property damages were reported. The nearby Vincenzo Bellini international airport was forced to shut due to the eruption. The airport said that though air traffic was partially resumed, it will remain restricted till the emergency ends.

411.title: Comedian Rosie misidentifies Priyanka Chopra; posts video apology
411.article_body: Actor-comedian Rosie O'Donnell posted a video saying she misidentified Priyanka Chopra when she met her and Nick Jonas in Malibu recently. Rosie posted another video to apologise to Priyanka. "Seated next to us in Malibu, at Nobu, was Nick Jonas and his wife, someone Chopra, which I always assumed was Deepak Chopra's daughter," Rosie said in the first video.

412.title: Yuvraj Singh shares handwritten letter for Virat Kohli, gifts him 'golden boots'
412.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh took to Instagram to share a handwritten letter dedicated to Virat Kohli and also gifted him 'golden boots'. "You've been a legendary captain and a fantastic leader. I am expecting many more of your famous run chases," Yuvraj wrote in the letter. He added, "Mere liye tu hamesha Cheeku rahega aur duniya ke liye King Kohli."

413.title: China asks banks, firms to report links to Jack Ma's Ant: Report
413.article_body: Chinese authorities have asked state-owned firms and banks to start new checks on their financial exposure and other links to Jack Ma's Ant Group, Bloomberg reported citing sources. Several institutions have been asked to examine all exposure to the fintech group, its subsidiaries and even its shareholders up to January. The regulators' initiative is being led by National Audit Office.

414.title: Phase out single-use plastic stocks by June 30: Delhi govt
414.article_body: The Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) asked manufacturers, retailers, shopkeepers and the general public to phase out single-use plastic (SUP) stocks by June 30, 2022. DPCC's order also asked all manufacturers of raw materials to cease the supply of plastic items to those engaged in the production of the banned SUP products to ensure they can be eliminated in Delhi.

415.title: Canada extends emergency to check further protests against COVID-19 curbs
415.article_body: The Canadian Parliament extended the emergency powers of the police to prevent further protests against COVID-19 restrictions. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said, "Right now... people [are] out there indicating that they are ready to blockade, to continue their illegal occupations to disrupt Canadians' lives. We feel that this measure needs to remain in place."

416.title: Man in custody for attacking PMC officials on being reassigned
416.article_body: A man was remanded to police custody on Monday for allegedly attacking and grievously injuring Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) officials at an impound facility. The accused is a PMC contract-based worker and was upset as he was recently reassigned, a police official said. The accused entered the facility falsely claiming that his vehicle was impounded, the police official added.

417.title: Don't feel like abusing knowing kids, uncles, aunties watch: YouTuber Nick
417.article_body: YouTuber Nikunj Lotia, known as Nick, said he does not feel like abusing in his videos after knowing "kids, uncles and aunties watch them". "When we started...we got noticed...and received good response from kids, uncles and aunties alike...I'm not against people who do it...I feel it's easier to do comedy when you abuse...I deliberately refrained from using them," he said.

418.title: Suryakumar is an innings builder and also a finisher: Gavaskar
418.article_body: Praising batter Suryakumar Yadav, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the 31-year-old is both "an innings builder and a finisher". "I think he's pretty much making a case for inclusion in the T20 World Cup team," Gavaskar added. Suryakumar remained unbeaten in first WI T20I to help India win and scored 65(31) in the third T20I to help India post 184/5.

419.title: Ambala fun park manager held as 1 dies after fall from Ferris wheel
419.article_body: The manager of a fun park in Haryana's Ambala was arrested on Monday following an incident wherein a teacher died and three students were injured after they fell from a Ferris wheel. The principal of the teacher's school denied the park owners' claims that cabin's grill broke while the teacher was taking selfies after being told not to do so.

420.title: 15-yr-old runaway girl from B'luru molested on train in Mumbai, 1 arrested
420.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly molesting a 15-year-old girl from Bengaluru, who had run away from her home after fighting with her parents. She realised she had made a mistake and got into a train to return home, when the man, who was in the same compartment, allegedly stood near her and touched her, police said.

421.title: He was like a big teddy bear: Ananya on 'Liger' co-star Mike Tyson
421.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday spoke about working with American boxer Mike Tyson in the forthcoming film 'Liger' and said that it was amazing. She added that he was very humble and was like a "big teddy bear". "He's actually really funny...So I'd just sit next to him and I observed him, it was like almost watching a lion in...wild," said Ananya.

422.title: SC-appointed committee submits interim report on Pegasus case
422.article_body: A Supreme Court-appointed committee probing the use of Pegasus for alleged spying has submitted its interim report. A bench headed by CJI NV Ramana will take up pending petitions for hearing on February 23. The committee had asked those who had "reasonable cause to suspect their mobiles had been infected with Pegasus" to submit their mobile phones.

423.title: My most challenging role so far was in 'Mardaani': Tahir Raj Bhasin
423.article_body: Discussing the most challenging role of his career so far, actor Tahir Raj Bhasin named his anti-hero character in Rani Mukerji-starrer 'Mardaani' which marked his Bollywood debut in 2014. "There was a lot of pressure of having to prove myself. It was also very different and so far-removed from my comfort zone," said Tahir.

424.title: Tamil Nadu BJP chief says its poll agent didn't seek hijab removal
424.article_body: After a BJP poll agent was arrested for allegedly objecting to a woman wearing a hijab during voting in Tamil Nadu's Madurai, the state BJP chief K Annamalai said that the agent hadn't sought the hijab's removal and only asked that her face should be seen for identification. The party will also approach the state election commission over the action.

425.title: 4.8 tonnes of red sanders worth ₹2.4 cr seized in Bengaluru
425.article_body: Custom officials seized red sanders weighing over 4.8 tonnes, estimated to be worth ₹2.4 crore at the Inland Cargo Depot in Bengaluru's Whitefield. According to the officials, the Taiwan-bound shipment had arrived from Tamil Nadu in which red sanders were kept concealed using plywood boxes. Upon inspection, the officials found 195 red sanders logs.

426.title: Biden blocks trade in parts of Ukraine recognised as independent by Russia
426.article_body: US President Joe Biden has signed an executive order to prohibit trade and investment between US individuals and the two breakaway regions of eastern Ukraine, Donetsk and Luhansk. This comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin recognised the regions as "independent" states. The move will deny Russia "the chance to profit from its blatant violations of international law", Biden said.

427.title: BJP will lose in all 5 poll-bound states: Congress' Prithviraj Chavan
427.article_body: Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan on Monday said the BJP will lose majority in all the five poll-bound states. "Last time, elections were contested on Ram Mandir issue and now it will be constructed or it's not an issue now," Chavan added. "PM Modi has nothing to speak about the China issue which has been created by him," Chavan stated.

428.title: Salman's 'Da-bangg' team to perform at Dubai Expo on February 25
428.article_body: Salman Khan and his 'Da-bangg' team will be performing at Dubai Expo on February 25. Jordy Patel of JA events and Salman's manager confirmed the news saying, "Da-bangg tour has travelled to about 40 cities across the world...and there are places which have invited the team again." Pooja Hegde and Disha Patani will reportedly be a part of the tour.

429.title: People have started recognising me even with mask on: Ashneer on 'Shark Tank'
429.article_body: Entrepreneur Ashneer Grover, who was seen in reality show 'Shark Tank India', said that people have started recognising him even with a mask on. "It's either my salt and pepper hair or glasses that give away," he said, adding, "I didn't have much expectation from Shark Tank. I didn't know what will happen in show and before and after show."

430.title: Will fight divisive, communal forces at national level: KCR
430.article_body: A day after meeting Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and NCP chief Sharad Pawar, Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao said he would fight the "divisive, communal forces" at the national level. "I seek [people's] blessings to fight with the divisive and communal forces at the national level…It is time to transform our country into Bangaru [golden] Bharat," he said.

431.title: Today my bathroom is as big as the house I once lived in: Nawazuddin on his bungalow
431.article_body: Talking about his new bungalow in Mumbai, actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said, "Today my personal bathroom is as big as the house I once lived in." He added, "When I moved to Mumbai, I stayed in such a small place, which I shared with four other budding actors...That room was so small that if you opened the door...it hit someone's feet."

432.title: Cadila Healthcare shares fall as Biological E's vaccine gets nod for 12-18 age group
432.article_body: Cadila Healthcare's shares fell over 3% on Tuesday after the Indian drug regulator DCGI granted emergency use approval to rival Biological E's COVID-19 vaccine Corbevax for children of 12-18 years age. Prior to this, Cadila Healthcare's ZyCoV-D and Bharat Biotech's Covaxin had received approval for use in adolescents. Corbevax is India's first indigenously developed RBD protein sub-unit vaccine.

433.title: We should own every part of our life: Paralympic gold medallist Avani on old pics
433.article_body: Shooter Avani Lekhara, the first Indian woman to win a Paralympic gold medal, took to Twitter to share old pictures taken after her car accident in 2012. "Wasn't sure about uploading these pictures but my parents said 'Achi ho ya buri ho hai to teri life ka part hi' and we should...own every part of our life," she wrote.

434.title: 16-year-old tribal girl gangraped in Chhattisgarh, 5 arrested
434.article_body: A 16-year-old tribal girl was allegedly abducted and gangraped by five people in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district, police said. Five persons have been arrested in connection to the case. "The incident took place when the minor girl had gone to attend a wedding function at a village in the district on February 17," Superintendent of Police, Jashpur, Vijay Agarwal said.

435.title: 11 killed, 2 injured after vehicle falls into gorge in Uttarakhand's Champawat
435.article_body: At least 11 people died and two were injured after the vehicle they were travelling in fell into a gorge near Sukhidhang Reetha Sahib road in Uttarakhand's Champawat, Kumaon DIG Nilesh Anand Bharney said. "The accident occurred early morning today when they were returning from a wedding ceremony," Bharney added. The two injured were taken to a nearby hospital.

436.title: Special Air India flight leaves for Ukraine to bring back Indians amid crisis
436.article_body: Air India's special flight left for Ukraine on Tuesday morning to bring back Indian nationals stranded in the country amid concerns of a Russian invasion. The Boeing 787 Dreamliner has been deployed for the special operation. The special flight from Ukraine will land in Delhi on Tuesday night. Air India will operate three flights between India and Ukraine this month.

437.title: EU sanctions 22 Myanmar officials, major energy company
437.article_body: The European Union has imposed sanctions on 22 Myanmar officials, including government ministers, and four entities "in view of the...intensifying human rights violations in Myanmar, following the military coup on February 1, 2021". Among those sanctioned was the state-owned Myanmar Oil and Gas Enterprise (MOGE), which is seen as a major source of revenue for the ruling Myanmar military junta.

438.title: 3 live human botflies removed from US woman's body at Delhi hospital
438.article_body: Doctors at Fortis hospital in Delhi's Vasant Kunj removed three live human botflies from body of a US woman — one from right upper eyelid, second one from back of her neck and third from her right forearm. "She had a history of visiting the Amazon jungle," doctors said. "It was a very rare case of myiasis," doctors further said.

439.title: K'taka MLA announces compensation to kin of killed Bajrang Dal activist
439.article_body: BJP MLA from Karnataka's Honnali MP Renukacharya announced ₹2 lakh compensation to the family of Bajrang Dal activist Harsha who was allegedly murdered in Shivamogga on Sunday. "The loss of Harsha is like losing my own son. I stand with his family...," he said. Three people have reportedly been taken into custody for the murder of the 26-year-old activist.

440.title: Raut working with Pawar to replace Uddhav as CM: BJP leader
440.article_body: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil on Monday alleged that Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut is working on NCP chief Sharad Pawar's agenda to replace Uddhav Thackeray as state CM. He claimed that as per their analysis, because they "can't make [Pawar's daughter Supriya Sule] CM directly, Raut will be made CM which ultimately will be like Sule as CM".

441.title: RAS Mains 2021 examination will not be postponed: Raj CM Gehlot
441.article_body: Rajasthan Administrative Services (RAS) Mains 2021 examination won't be postponed and will be conducted as per schedule on February 25 and 26, 2022, Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said on Monday. "Priority of the state government is to complete all the recruitment examinations in a time-bound manner. The demand for postponement of the RAS main examination is not justified," he tweeted.

442.title: Being over possessive ruins a relationship: 'Naagin 6' actor Ashish
442.article_body: Talking about his character in 'Naagin 6' where he plays Tejasswi Prakash's overly possessive boyfriend, actor Ashish Trivedi said being overly possessive ruins a relationship. "Always doubting your partner won't take a relationship anywhere. Give your partner their space," added Ashish. "Shooting with Tejasswi is fun. She's a fine actress and a supportive co-actor," stated Ashish.

443.title: Instagram removes daily time limit options below 30 mins from app
443.article_body: Instagram has removed the ability for mobile users to set a lower daily time limit reminder than 30 minutes. The daily limit options currently available are 30 minutes, 45 minutes, one hour, two hours, and three hours. A user, who previously had a 10 minutes limit, told TechCrunch they were asked to "set a new value for your daily limit".

444.title: Panipat man sentenced to 20 years in jail for raping minor stepdaughter
444.article_body: A fast-track court in Panipat sentenced a man to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment on Monday for raping his eight-year-old stepdaughter. The incident took place on August 14, 2018, when the girl's mother was not at home. When she returned, the girl alleged her stepfather raped her in an inebriated condition and slapped her when she tried to stop him.

445.title: Dhoni asked me to focus on batting on the day he announced retirement: Chahar
445.article_body: India fast bowler Deepak Chahar has revealed that MS Dhoni had asked him to focus on his batting on the day the former India captain announced retirement. "Mahi bhai said to me, 'You have done a good job with the bowling but haven't justified your batting'," Chahar stated. The 29-year-old scored 38 runs in the third ODI against West Indies.

446.title: Neighbours kill man after fight over water wastage in Tamil Nadu
446.article_body: A 27-year-old man, Dineshkumar, was killed by neighbours after fight over his grandmother, Ranganayaki, using extra water for washing clothes in Tamil Nadu. His neighbour Agalya questioned Ranganayaki for wasting water, after which deceased's sister went to Agalya's house. Agalya's brother, along with his friends, assaulted Dineshkumar. He was taken to hospital and was declared dead.

447.title: Marriage certificate not essential condition for adopting a child: HC
447.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has observed that a marriage certificate is not an essential condition for adopting a child. According to the court, even a single parent can adopt a child under the Hindu Adoptions and Maintenance Act, 1956. The court's observation came while it was hearing a petition filed by a transgender person and her partner.

448.title: 4 held in Gujarat's Ahmedabad for cryptocurrency investment fraud
448.article_body: The Ahmedabad Cyber Crime Cell in Gujarat arrested four persons for allegedly cheating several people for lakhs of rupees by promising them higher returns on investment in 'Tron' cryptocurrency. "They floated a fake company named Bulltron and started contacting victims on a multi-marketing level asking them to invest money through a mobile app of their company," a police official said.

449.title: 8 arrested after 54-year-old CPI(M) worker stabbed to death in Kerala
449.article_body: Kerala Police on Monday arrested eight people after a 54-year-old worker of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) was stabbed to death in Thalassery in Kerala's Kannur district. The victim was returning home from work when the incident took place. "Assailants came on two motorbikes, and they were waiting...His brother also sustained injuries while trying to save him," police said.

450.title: I looked really strange after my cosmetic procedures: Courteney
450.article_body: Actress Courteney Cox revealed she spent years "chasing youthfulness," but she no longer undergoes "crazy" procedures. She added, "There was a time when you go, 'Oh, I’m changing. I'm looking older'." "I didn't realise that, oh s***, I’m...looking really strange with injections and doing stuff to my face that I would never do now," Courteney said.

451.title: Dalit youth beaten with shoe, dragged with belt tied around neck in UP; 2 held
451.article_body: Two people have been arrested for allegedly beating up a Dalit youth with a shoe and dragging him with a belt tied around his neck in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar, police said. The accused were identified as the village head's husband and his relative. Local residents said a community panchayat had been convened to resolve a dispute between the two parties.

452.title: I was ragged, called Maggi noodles in college since I had curly hair: Siddhant
452.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said he was ragged a lot in college. "Since I had curly hair, I was called Maggi noodles. I was very under-confident," he added. Siddhant said once he started doing theatre and explored dance in college, he got a lot of attention. "It also made me realise that all this attention and fame is temporary," he added.

453.title: Not my intention to harm somebody's career: Saha on not revealing journalist's identity
453.article_body: Wriddhiman Saha, who had shared a screenshot of WhatsApp messages sent to him by a journalist forcing him to give an interview, has suggested that he won't reveal the identity of the journalist. "If BCCI ask me to reveal the name...I would tell them it was never my intention to harm somebody's career, to pull a person down," he said.

454.title: 103 vehicles towed, clamped in Mumbai during drive against illegal parking
454.article_body: As many as 103 vehicles were towed and clamped on Sant Rohidas Marg as part of a special drive carried out on 90 Feet Road in Mumbai's Dharavi against illegal parking in the city. While the two-wheeler vehicles parked on this stretch were towed and the motorists were issued e-challans, the four-wheelers were clamped at the spot over traffic violation.

455.title: Sensex crashes 1,000 points, Nifty below 16,900 amid Russia-Ukraine tensions
455.article_body: The Sensex tanked more than 1,000 points in early trade following a sell-off in global markets after Russia ordered deployment of troops in two breakaway regions in Ukraine. In the pre-opening session, the Sensex fell 1,245 points lower to 56,438.6, while the broader Nifty 50 plunged 359 points at 16,848. US stock index futures also tumbled amid the geopolitical tensions.

456.title: Case registered against Akhilesh Yadav for MCC violation in UP’s Saifai
456.article_body: A case has been registered at the Saifai Police Station in UP's Etawah against Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav for violation of the Model Code of Conduct (MCC), on February 20, the Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) Saifai said. Sixteen districts including Etawah and Mainpuri went to the polls in the third phase of UP Assembly elections on Sunday.

457.title: Colombia's top court decriminalises abortion up to 24 weeks of pregnancy
457.article_body: Women cannot be prosecuted for getting abortions up to 24 weeks of pregnancy in Colombia as the country's constitutional court decriminalised it on Monday. The ruling was supported by five of the nine judges. Earlier, abortion was allowed with no time limit only in cases of rape, fatal fetal deformity or where health of the woman was concerned.

458.title: India reports 13,405 new COVID-19 cases, over 2,600 cases less than yesterday
458.article_body: India has reported 13,405 new COVID-19 cases and 235 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 16,051 cases and 206 deaths. The COVID-19 daily positivity rate fell from 1.93% to 1.24% in the country, while the active caseload declined to 1,81,075.

459.title: Won't give anything to anyone: Ukraine as Russia deploys troops in 2 breakaway regions
459.article_body: As Russia ordered troops into two breakaway regions in Ukraine after recognising their independence, President Volodymyr Zelensky in a 2 am address said, "We are on our land, we aren't afraid of anything and anyone." "We don't owe anything to anyone and we won't give away anything to anyone," he added. Zelensky stated that Russia's move violated Ukraine's "national integrity".

460.title: I know I've let people down: Jhingan on saying 'Played with women' after match
460.article_body: ATK Mohun Bagan defender Sandesh Jhingan has apologised for saying he 'played with women' after their 2-2 draw against Kerala Blasters in ISL. "What I said in the heat of the game, is, it's wrong, and I'm truly sorry for it and I know I have let many people down, including myself and my family," he stated.

461.title: 24-year-old US man tries to enter zoo's tiger cage; arrested
461.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested on Monday for trying to enter a tiger enclosure after breaking into Franklin Park Zoo in US' Boston. Matthew Abraham allegedly scaled multiple fences in his attempt to get to the tigers, ignoring warning signs advising the public to stay out of that area, police said. He has been charged with trespassing and disorderly conduct.

462.title: Cannot afford to have a military escalation: India on Russia-Ukraine crisis
462.article_body: At the emergency meeting called by UN Security Council amid Russia-Ukraine crisis, India said, "We strongly emphasise vital need for all sides to maintain international peace and security by exercising the utmost restraint." "We cannot afford to have a military escalation. The escalation of tension along the border of Ukraine with Russia is a matter of deep concern," India added.

463.title: Cong’s V Hanumantha Rao files complaint over morphed pic of him with KCR
463.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao filed a police complaint over an alleged morphed picture of him with Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao. “Some vested interests posted a morphed photograph on social media, showing myself and Jagga Reddy with CM KCR. This photograph carried a caption stating that we both are supporting the TRS...This is just absurd and meaningless,” Rao said.

464.title: Delhi's Connaught Place traders request LG to allow shops to open till 10 pm
464.article_body: New Delhi Traders Association (NDTA) at Connaught Place has requested Lieutenant Governor (LG) Anil Baijal to allow shops to remain open till 10 pm. "In UP and Haryana, night curfew...have been removed but in Delhi, timings for closing shops is same at 8 pm, which is causing huge financial losses to shop owners," NDTA wrote to the LG.

465.title: JeM terrorist aiming to carry out an attack arrested in J&K: Police
465.article_body: A Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terrorist was arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Handwara on Monday.  "He revealed...he has come here to carry out the attack in the area. Being a hybrid terrorist of the JeM...he was working on the direction of his Pakistan handlers across the border," police said. They also recovered one pistol with magazine and five pistol rounds from him.

466.title: Kerala man gets death sentence for murdering newly-wed couple
466.article_body: A Kerala court awarded the death penalty to a 48-year-old man convicted of killing a newly married couple in Kerala's Wayanad district in 2018. The prosecution found that robbery was the motive behind the double murder. The court also awarded seven years of rigorous imprisonment for robbery, ten years for housebreaking and seven years for destruction of evidence.

467.title: You don't need valentine, you need quarantine: Shehnaaz as ill fan asks for hug
467.article_body: Actress and former Bigg Boss contestant Shehnaaz Gill recently interacted with her fans and followers on Twitter. She replied to a fan who wrote, "Shehnaaz [I'm]...not well. Can you please give me a hug?" "Maintain 6 feet distance...You don't need valentine, you need quarantine," Shehnaaz jokingly said. She was last seen in the grand finale of Bigg Boss 15.

468.title: UK PM Johnson removes all COVID-19 restrictions in England
468.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has announced the removal of all COVID-19 restrictions in England. "Restrictions pose a heavy toll on our economy, society, mental wellbeing and on the life chances of our children, and we do not need to pay that cost any longer," he told parliament. "So let us learn to live with this virus," he added.

469.title: Cyberabad police warns people against jaywalking; shares video
469.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Monday shared a video of people getting into accidents while jaywalking and urged pedestrians to not do so as they're "likely to receive very serious injuries". "If crosswalks aren't available...cross at intersections and...when permitted to do so by traffic lights," the police said. The police also asked people to "never step out into traffic".

470.title: 66-year-old man robbed of ₹1.1 lakh gold chain by 2 men in Pune
470.article_body: A 66-year-old man was allegedly robbed of his gold chain worth around ₹1.1 lakh by two men under the pretext of asking for directions in Pune. The man, who was tired, had stopped his car on the road when incident occurred. The accused woke the man, asked him to come out of car and show the directions, a sub-inspector said.

471.title: Annual Mumbai Bird Race records highest species tally in 7 years
471.article_body: The annual Mumbai Bird Race, that was held on February 20, reportedly recorded the highest species tally of Mumbai Metropolitan Region and surrounding areas in seven years. Reports said that 60 teams, comprising of about 350 birders, sighted around 250 different species of birds. "We had a tremendous participation this year...results are notable," one of the organisers said.

472.title: 100 workers start demolishing Supertech's 40-storey twin towers in Noida
472.article_body: At least 100 workers started demolishing the walls of Supertech's twin 40-storey residential towers in Noida on Monday. According to the demolition contractor, workers will continue removing debris and tear down the walls before the main blast takes place on May 22. The Supreme Court had ordered the demolition of the twin towers in August, 2021 over violation of norms.

473.title: Trump's Truth Social app tops downloads on Apple's App Store in US
473.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's new social media venture, Truth Social, was the top free app available on Apple's App Store early Monday but faced several technical problems. Several US users reported either having trouble registering for an account or being added to a waitlist. The app has been available for people invited to use it during its test phase.

474.title: 20-yr-old boy kills father by banging head against wall in TN, held
474.article_body: A 20-year-old man, Manikandan, was arrested for allegedly killing his 60-year-old father, Venu, by banging his head against the wall of house in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvallur district. Police probe revealed that Manikandan was jobless and used to consume alcohol on regular basis. He reportedly also attacked Venu at times to forcibly take money from him. Neighbours informed police about incident.

475.title: Have to be harsh in the nets: Suryakumar on being Man of the Series vs WI
475.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav, who was named Man of the Series for his performance in the T20Is against West Indies, has said he's just trying to keep things simple. "[I'm] being a little harsh on [myself] in the nets, [not] hitting every ball wildly and having some quality sessions," he added. Suryakumar scored 31-ball 65 in the third WI T20I.

476.title: History-sheeter from Pune shot dead, police suspect land dispute
476.article_body: A 36-year-old man from Pune, who had earlier been booked in Matka gambling cases, was shot dead in Maharashtra's Satara district on Sunday. Sanjay Patole was found dead on a building's seventh-floor terrace in Lake Palace Society "with a gunshot injury on...back of his head", police said. Police suspect a land deal dispute to be the reason behind the murder.

477.title: Delhi to get 100 more new electric buses by March
477.article_body: Delhi will get 100 more new electric buses by March, followed by 200 more by mid-May, transport officials said. "In the first week of March...50 e-buses...expected to arrive. Overall, in March, 100 of the 300 e-buses will arrive," an official said. The current fleet of 6,894 CNG buses is the most Delhi ever had, Transport Commissioner Ashish Kundra said.

478.title: BMC to build treehouse with sea view in Mumbai's Bandra
478.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation will be constructing treehouse in Mumbai's Bandra (West). Treehouse will reportedly give people of Mumbai, an expansive view of Arabian Sea. It will be constructed by replicating model of two-storeyed house. It's design will be in line with 'Old Woman's Shoe viewing tower'. Officials said the District Planning Development Committee will be funding the project.

479.title: Pakistani cricketer Haris Rauf slaps teammate for dropping catch, video goes viral
479.article_body: A video showing Pakistani fast bowler Haris Rauf slapping his Lahore Qalandars' teammate Kamran Ghulam for dropping a catch during their PSL 2022 match against Peshawar Zalmi has gone viral on social media. "He should apologise. This attitude is not tolerable," a Twitter user commented. "Zero sportsmanship, thinking about the outrage if Sarfaraz Ahmed did this," wrote another.

480.title: This is nonsense: US as Putin deploys soldiers in 2 breakaway regions in Ukraine
480.article_body: As Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered the deployment of soldiers to two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine after recognising them as independent, US said, "He (Putin) calls them (soldiers) peacekeepers. This is nonsense." "President Putin is testing our international system," the US further said at the emergency UN Security Council meeting.

481.title: Pretext for further invasion: US on Russia recognising Ukraine's breakaway regions
481.article_body: The US ambassador to the UN said that Russian President Vladimir Putin's recognition of two breakaway regions in Ukraine as independent was an "attempt to create a pretext for the further invasion of Ukraine". "Russia's clear attack on Ukraine's territorial integrity and sovereignty is unprovoked. It violates basic principles of international law," Linda Thomas-Greenfield added.

482.title: We didn’t know her lineage: Goldie on casting Avantika Dassani in 'Mithya'
482.article_body: Filmmaker Goldie Behl said that the team of 'Mithya' did not know what actress Avantika Dassani's "lineage" was. "We wanted someone who is not well known...people don't know what to expect from her...That was...why we cast her...Credit to Avantika, she came through normal casting process: through the casting director via audition...we just found her interesting for the part," he said.

483.title: For security reasons: US sends remaining envoys in Ukraine to Poland
483.article_body: The US on Monday said "for security reasons" it's sending all its diplomats in Ukraine to "spend the night in Poland". "Our personnel will regularly return to continue their diplomatic work in Ukraine and provide emergency consular services," it added. This comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered troops into two rebel-backed regions in Ukraine after recognising them as independent.

484.title: Russia President Putin recognises 2 breakaway regions in Ukraine as independent
484.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday recognised two breakaway regions in Ukraine as independent. Russian-backed separatists in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions, collectively known as the Donbass, broke away from Ukrainian government control in 2014 and proclaimed themselves independent "people's republics". Putin also ordered the deployment of soldiers to the two breakaway regions.

485.title: IDFC FIRST Bank MD gifts shares worth ₹3.95 cr to driver, 4 others to buy houses
485.article_body: IDFC FIRST Bank MD and CEO V Vaidyanathan has gifted 9 lakh shares of the bank held by him worth ₹3.95 crore, to five individuals, including a driver and house help, to help them purchase homes. Additionally, the Rukmani Social Welfare Trust has disposed of 2 lakh equity shares to support social activities. Vaidyanathan is a trustee of Rukmani trust.

486.title: Allow unvaccinated people in local trains: Bombay HC to Maha govt
486.article_body: The Bombay HC has sought Maharashtra government's response on whether it is willing to withdraw last year's notification banning people not vaccinated against COVID-19 from travelling in local trains in the city. The court, which was hearing two public interest litigations against the notifications on Monday, said, "Chief Secretary has to withdraw order...now Covid-19 situation has improved."

487.title: BJP wants to destroy Manipur's future: Rahul at Imphal rally
487.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday targeted the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and Prime Minister Narendra Modi while addressing people at an election rally in poll-bound Manipur. "The BJP wants to destroy Manipur's future by creating palm oil plantations...who do they help?" he said at the rally in Imphal. He further stated that BJP is "attacking" the state's democratic values.

488.title: Want strict action: Brother of Bajrang Dal activist killed in K'taka
488.article_body: The brother of Bajrang Dal activist Harsha, who was stabbed in Karnataka's Shivamogga, has said that he and his family want strict action to be taken against the culprits. Praveen, while speaking with ANI further said, "He only used to think about Hindus and that is what killed him." He called his brother an "active member of the Sangathan".

489.title: Delhi HC reserves judgment on criminalisation of marital rape
489.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday rejected the Centre's request for more time to respond to the petitions seeking criminalisation of marital rape and reserved its judgment in the case. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta requested for deferment of proceedings, stating that the Centre has written to the chief secretaries of the state governments and Union Territories on marital rape.

490.title: Congress worker killed after being run over in Ludhiana, 3 booked
490.article_body: Three people have been booked for allegedly running over two Congress supporters with their Toyota Innova in Ludhiana, just a day before polling. The incident which took place near Samrala on Saturday killed 19-year-old Lovepreet Singh and left Harvinder Singh alias Ravi of Mushkabad village, critically injured. The duo was said to have been on a motorcycle.

491.title: SP only cares about its dynasty, won't win elections: BJP UP chief
491.article_body: During a door-to-door campaign in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow, BJP UP president Swatantra Dev Singh commented on the Samajwadi Party and said that the "Parivarvadi party" only cares about its dynasty and won't win the elections. Singh said that the poor in UP are happy because of schemes carried out by PM Narendra Modi and UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath.

492.title: 11-yr-old girl abducted, raped and murdered in Gujarat; 2 detained
492.article_body: An 11-year-old girl was kidnapped, raped and murdered in Gujarat's Surat district reportedly when her parents were away. Police said they have detained two suspects for questioning following the incident, which occurred on Sunday near Palsana town, located 15 km away from Surat. A police official said the girl was attacked after being taken to a flat near her residence.

493.title: Jailed gangster's assets worth ₹60 lakh seized by Meerut police
493.article_body: Property worth ₹60 lakh belonging to jailed gangster Haji Parvez, who has several cases registered against him including under the Gangster's Act, has been seized by Meerut Police. The properties include three houses in UP's Sanota village which were seized following an operation conducted by Circle Officer Uday Pratap Singh. Police revealed that Parvez's brother Shuaib is also in jail.

494.title: 4 dead, 41 hospitalised after drinking adulterated liquor in UP
494.article_body: At least four people have died and 41 have been admitted to a hospital after consuming adulterated liquor in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh, according to a report by ANI. Azamgarh District Magistrate Amrit Tripathi said the incident took place on Sunday evening. Over two dozen people fainted after consuming adulterated liquor and were rushed to nearby hospitals, local police officials added.

495.title: You reap what you sow: Bihar Deputy CM on Lalu Yadav's jail term
495.article_body: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Renu Devi commented on former Bihar Chief Minister Lalu Prasad Yadav's sentencing in the final fodder scam case and said, "As you sow, so you shall reap." "This is what the outcome is. If we also do this, it will happen to us also." Yadav was sentenced to five years in jail and fined ₹60 lakh.

496.title: Lalu Yadav's kidney functioning at 20% capacity: RIMS official
496.article_body: RJD leader Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is admitted to Ranchi's Rajendra Institute of Medical Sciences, is serious but stable, a hospital official stated. He's in stage 4 of a kidney ailment and his kidney is functioning at 20% capacity, the official said, adding his condition is being monitored closely. Yadav was convicted in the fifth fodder scam case last week.

497.title: Band artists die of electrocution at Haryana wedding
497.article_body: Two band artists died of electrocution at a marriage function in Haryana after coming in contact with a live wire. The incident took place in Junhera village in Tigaon area on Sunday night while 25-year-old Akbar and Atru, 45, were holding umbrella lights when a band was accompanying a wedding party. Their bodies were handed to family members after post-mortem.

498.title: Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray launches scuba dive boat
498.article_body: Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Monday launched a scuba dive boat in Tarkarli MTDC, Sindhudurg in Maharashtra.  The new Armour dive boat, which is the state's first, was taken for a short spin by Thackeray. "I was truly amazed to see how the scuba diving centre...is geared to provide an adrenaline rush for...tourists and job opportunities for...locals," he said.

499.title: Plurality of languages needs celebration in India today: Mamata
499.article_body: While addressing a gathering at Deshapriya Park on the occasion of 'International Mother Language Day', West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said, "Plurality of languages needs celebration in India today." She also said that the "contributions of Bengal and Bengalis" have been immense. "I do respect every language, but I am proud of being a Bengali," said Mamata.

500.title: RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat visits Ujjain temple, devotees report 'ruckus'
500.article_body: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Monday visited Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga to attend the Bhasma Aarti in Ujjain due to which the aarti was cancelled for other devotees. This was followed by 'ruckus' being reported by devotees for not allowing them in the temple. According to reports, fewer devotees were allowed in the aarti due to his safety.
